{"uri": "8094861350", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "12:09:24", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T12:09:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T12:09:12Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8588235378265381, "url": "https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-13344573/Jurgen-Klopps-Liverpool-Arne-Slot-Diego-Simeone.html", "title": "Charismatic Arne Slot isn't one to shirk a challenge", "body": "Nottingham Forest have been stripped bare of their sympathy after three ropey decisions - Listen to the It's All Kicking Off podcast\n\nDiego Simeone isn't the most difficult football manager to wind up but Arne Slot's reaction spoke volumes.\n\nThe Atletico Madrid boss got physical with his Dutch counterpart after Feyenoord beat them in a 2021 friendly, shoving Slot in the chest and launching a verbal volley.\n\nSlot's Stone Island gear suggested he might have been up for a scrap but instead he just stood his ground and smiled mockingly at Simeone, who backed down.\n\nIt was the sign of a man who doesn't shy away from a challenge.\n\nFeyenoord's coach is ruthlessly ambitious and a control freak who demands total control at a club. But he also has emotional intelligence, knows how to create a team ethic and plays attractive football.\n\nFeyenoord coach Arne Slot has emerged as Liverpool's favoured candidate to succeed Jurgen Klopp - with talks between the two clubs underway\n\nAtletico Madrid coach Diego Simeone tried to pick a fight with Slot after a friendly in 2021\n\nIn response to being shoved, the Stone Island-wearing Slot just smiled back at Simeone\n\nView this post on Instagram\n\nA post shared by The Hooligan Scene \ud835\udd73 (@thehooliganscene)\n\nYour browser does not support iframes.\n\nSo there are reasons both for and against his suitability for the unenviable task of succeeding Jurgen Klopp at Liverpool.\n\nREAD MORE: Liverpool open talks with Feyenoord after identifying Arne Slot as the ideal candidate to succeed Jurgen Klopp... as Reds face \u00a38.5m compensation fee to land the Dutchman Advertisement\n\nSlot, 45, who has just backed up last season's Eredivisie title win by delivering the KNVB Cup to Rotterdam, has emerged as a strong contender for the Anfield gig.\n\nIndeed, on Wednesday morning it emerged talks have already begun between Liverpool and Feyenoord with the compensation fee set at \u00a38.5million.\n\nOn the face of it, Slot's 4-3-3 formation, intensity of pressing and high energy attacking bears many resemblances to Klopp's 'heavy metal' (Slot is more into his rap music).\n\nBut the Liverpool vacancy requires so much more that just a good tactician.\n\nFor nine years, Klopp has carried not only a club but at times a city defiant in its own identity and independence.\n\nThat emotional burden has ultimately caught up with him but not before he won the biggest honours in the game.\n\nLiverpool's new manager must not only perform in Klopp's lingering shadow but somehow keep up his boundless energy and forge the same bonds with a demanding fanbase and players that aren't his own.\n\nThe experiences of David Moyes and Unai Emery, after Sir Alex Ferguson at Manchester United and Arsene Wenger at Arsenal, have shown just how difficult it is to follow a manager of legendary stature.\n\nSucceeding the immensely popular Jurgen Klopp at Liverpool is an unenviable challenge\n\nSlot delivered the Eredivisie league title to Feyenoord last season, their first since 2017\n\nSome would say the man who follows Klopp is on a similar hiding to nothing even if Liverpool fans would surely be sympathetic and patient if there was regression next season.\n\nREAD MORE: Arne Slot has been compared to Pep Guardiola, is 'the most attack-minded coach in the Netherlands since Johan Cruyff' and 'holds all the power at Feyenoord'... what Liverpool fans can expect if he replaces Jurgen Klopp Advertisement\n\nLike Klopp, Slot had a respectable but hardly spectacular playing career at the likes of FC Zwolle and NAC Breda rather than Ajax or Feyenoord.\n\nBut when it comes to coaching, Slot sees no reason to curb his ambitions, even if it has rubbed people up the wrong way.\n\nAZ Alkmaar abruptly sacked him in December 2020 because owner Robert Eenhoorn learned he'd attended a clandestine meeting with Feyenoord and agreed to replace Dick Advocaat.\n\nEven as he wins trophies at Feyenoord, Slot has been unafraid to speak about his personal career trajectory.\n\n'My next step will not be a club in Holland,' he said in 2023. 'If that is my next step, then I've failed completely.\n\n'The normal next step will be to go abroad and I've always said the best league in the world is the Premier League.'\n\nThe Premier League has fluttered its eyelashes back across the North Sea. Crystal Palace were interested and Leeds made Slot their first-choice replacement for Jesse Marsch in February 2023 - though negotiations didn't get going.\n\nTottenham Hotspur thought they'd persuaded him to become their manager in May 2023 before Slot surprisingly decided to stay at Feyenoord and Daniel Levy turned to Ange Postecoglou.\n\nSlot favours attacking, high-energy football - something that would win him favour at Anfield\n\nBut Slot has been able to take control of all aspects of running Feyenoord, which wouldn't be possible at Liverpool\n\nGiven that Slot demands a significant degree of control over all aspects of the club's operations, you wonder how that would have worked with Levy.\n\nThere was friction when he came in at Feyenoord, with a number of scouts and recruitment specialists leaving the club because of how Slot wanted them to work.\n\nHe certainly wouldn't get that control at Anfield, though it's only right he has a big say over recruitment to evolve Liverpool in his image post-Klopp.\n\nThe other big unknown is how Slot would handle the intense scrutiny that would come with the Liverpool job - especially if things are going wrong.\n\nWhile the Dutch media and fans aren't known for holding back in their forthright opinions, Liverpool with their global fame are several levels above Feyenoord in the pressure stakes.\n\nHis time at De Kuip has been predominantly successful - he took them to the inaugural Europa Conference League final, where they lost to Jose Mourinho's Roma, then won a first league title since 2017.\n\nFeyenoord celebrate winning the Dutch Cup after they beat NEC Nijmegen last weekend\n\nPSV Eindhoven have been superior in the Eredivisie this season but Feyenoord beat NEC last weekend to win the Cup.\n\nBut given even a small number of games without a victory can constitute a disaster at Liverpool, Slot hasn't yet been stress-tested in this way.\n\nIndeed, Bayern Munich reportedly looked at and rejected Slot because he doesn't yet have that kind of experience.\n\nWhat he will bring - like Klopp - is relentless positivity. Liverpool fans are already fawning over a video of one of his team talks - delivered in his perfect English - after Feyenoord won 3-2 at Ajax en route to the championship.\n\nSlot would aim to replicate Klopp's passion if he lands the Liverpool gig in the weeks ahead\n\nWhile Slot acknowledged a first victory in Amsterdam for 17 years was a seminal moment, he quickly reminded his players it was 'only one win' and the job wasn't yet done.\n\nYou can certainly hear echoes of Klopp in it and his players were duly crowned champions two months later. By the end, it's apparent his team will run through brick walls for him.\n\nSo Slot certainly brings similarities to Klopp in terms of charisma and motivation, as well as outlook on how his teams should play their football.\n\nThe great unknown is what happens at Liverpool when such a unique figure as Klopp is taken out of the equation.\n\nWhat's clear with Slot, however, is that he certainly wouldn't shirk the challenge if presented with it.", "source": {"uri": "dailymail.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "Daily Mail Online"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": He can really go anywhere - Bayern Munich, Liverpool... I'm really convinced of that.\n\n'I've spoken to him a few times and I think what he does and what he sees is very strong. He gets along very well with the group of players, is tactically well-versed, can explain things well and is calm and intelligent. I think he can go to any club, even at the very difficult clubs, because he is so intelligent.\n\n'He has a lot of qualities and he shows it at every level. He first did it at AZ Alkmaar, and now at Feyenoord. And Feyenoord is a really complicated club. He has been doing well for three years, while PSV and Ajax have much more options in terms of money.\n\n'He could really fit anywhere. If you get AZ and Feyenoord to play football, you also get big clubs like AC Milan to play football. You can clearly see his hand where he is the coach.\n\n'I think it will even be easier for him at a higher level because he has better players who understand his ideas faster. {"uri": "8094905580", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "12:35:21", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T12:35:21Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T12:34:59Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8392156958580017, "url": "https://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/chelsea/news/liverpool-open-talks-with-leading-candidate-to-succeed-klopp_542064.html", "title": "Liverpool 'open talks with leading candidate to succeed Klopp'", "body": "Liverpool allegedly open talks with Feyenoord over Arne Slot, who is wanted to replace Jurgen Klopp at Anfield this summer. Liverpool have reportedly opened talks with Feyenoord over Arne Slot, with the Dutchman emerging as the favourite to replace Jurgen Klopp at the helm this summer.\n\nThe Reds are facing the hugely difficult task of replacing the inspirational Klopp at the end of the season, with the German standing down from his role once the 2023-24 campaign has concluded.\n\nSporting Lisbon head coach Ruben Amorim had seemingly been the favourite to replace Klopp, but the 39-year-old is now being heavily linked with West Ham United, with David Moyes potentially leaving the London Stadium this summer.\n\nSpeculation linking Slot with the managerial role at Anfield has gathered pace in recent days, and according to Sky Sports News, discussions between the two clubs have now started.\n\nThe report claims that the 45-year-old is determined to complete a move to the Merseyside giants, and there is hope that compensation of around \u00a39m could be agreed.\n\n\u00a9 Reuters\n\nLiverpool 'open talks with Feyenoord over Arne Slot deal'\n\nLiverpool are allegedly attracted to Slot's 'aggressive and full-throttle' brand of football, and he has enjoyed huge success since taking charge of Feyenoord in July 2021.\n\nSlot led his current side to last season's Eredivisie title, while he secured the Dutch Cup last weekend courtesy of a 1-0 success over NEC and finished as a runner-up in the 2021-22 Europa Conference League.\n\nThe Rotterdam outfit are second in the 2023-24 Eredivisie table despite losing just twice from 30 games, with PSV Eindhoven on course to win the title this term.\n\nThe Dutchman's record at Feyenoord is 94 wins, 29 draws and 23 losses from 146 matches, while he has also managed Cambuur and AZ since stepping into coaching in 2016.\n\n\u00a9 Reuters\n\nTottenham Hotspur 'wanted Arne Slot last summer'\n\nTottenham Hotspur were allegedly 'determined' to bring in Slot last summer, but he ultimately decided to sign a new contract with Feyenoord until the summer of 2026.\n\nAt the time, Slot said that he 'was not done' at Feyenoord, but Liverpool appear to have turned his head, and an agreement could be reached relatively quickly.\n\n\"I think it is logical that he is in such a good position. It is very special how he has manifested himself in recent years and has really given Feyenoord a face,\" Feyenoord technical director Dennis te Kloese recently told ESPN.\n\n\"We responded by extending his contract (in May last year until 2026). In any case, we assume that he will also be our trainer next year. We have experienced this situation before and will take good care of our own interests.\"\n\nChelsea and Leeds United are also both believed to have been interested in Slot during his time at Feyenoord, but it appears that he could now arrive in the Premier League at Liverpool.\n\nID:542064:1false2false3false:QQ:: from db desktop :LenBod:collect5367:", "source": {"uri": "sportsmole.co.uk", {"uri": "8097227595", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-25", "time": "18:04:13", "dateTime": "2024-04-25T18:04:13Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-25T18:03:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8392156958580017, "url": "https://www.givemesport.com/jacobs-liverpool-have-good-feyenoord-relations-amid-slot-move/", "title": "Liverpool Could Need to Pay \u00a313m for Arne Slot and his Staff", "body": "Liverpool have moved for Arne Slot to become their new boss and his release clause is known to the club\n\nHighlights Arne Slot is Liverpool's top managerial target after previous candidates fell through, and the Reds know what his release clause is. Liverpool's strong relationship with Feyenoord may help seal the deal for Slot despite their initial bid being rejected. Negotiations for Slot included an offer of \u20ac9million, though Feyenoord want more as it could involve backroom staff moving to Anfield.\n\nLiverpool's strong relationship with Feyenoord amid their pursuit of Arne Slot to become their new boss could stand them in good stead when it comes to appointing the Dutchman - and Ben Jacobs has exclusively told GIVEMESPORT that whilst their opening bid has been rejected, Liverpool aren't far off agreeing a deal as they know the release clause.\n\nSlot has come from nowhere as an option to move to Anfield after failed moves for other managers on the market, and with talks ramping up throughout the week, the 45-year-old appears destined to become the new boss of the Premier League title chasers.\n\nArne Slot: Liverpool Manager Latest Arne Slot has been fast-tracked to become Liverpool's top target\n\nSlot has become Liverpool's top target after moves for their previous two ideal candidates broke down. Xabi Alonso was thought to be Liverpool's top target once Jurgen Klopp announced that he would be leaving Anfield, but after two months of speculation, the Spaniard committed his future to Bayer Leverkusen - leaving Liverpool looking for a new manager once again.\n\nSporting Lisbon boss Ruben Amorim was the man next linked with a move to the red half of Merseyside, and whilst it looked for all the world that he would become the successor to Klopp in the Liverpool throne, reports earlier in the week suggesting that he had flown to London for talks with West Ham coupled with his potential move to Liverpool breaking down saw the club move on once again.\n\nRelated Liverpool and Klopp Disagreed Over Darwin Nunez Signing Liverpool forward Darwin Nunez has come under plenty of scrutiny this season, and Paul Joyce has suggested it was a Jurgen Klopp signing.\n\nSlot is now the man touted to become the new manager, and that has led to reports that Liverpool have opened negotiations with Feyenoord to bring him over. Having won the Dutch Cup last week and with PSV Eindhoven just one win away from securing the Eredivisie, Feyenoord's season is all but over as they are bound to finish in second place - leaving Slot free to undergo contract negotiations with the Reds.\n\nJacobs Says Liverpool Have Good Relationship With Feyenoord Liverpool have supposedly done their business in the correct manner\n\nSpeaking exclusively to GIVEMESPORT, Jacobs said that Liverpool have a better chance at bringing Slot into the club as a result of their strong negotiations with Feyenoord - whilst they know the release clause to bring him to the Premier League. He said:\n\n\"Because they've got a good relationship with Feyenoord, and because they've gone about their approach in the right way - they didn't hold their formal talks or make their first offer until after Feyenoord's cup final victory - which was definitely appreciated by Feyenoord.\n\n\"The expectation from sources is that the compensation is not going to be \u20ac20million. Liverpool's first offer was \u20ac9million but that has been rejected.\n\n\"And as I've reported before, I was always told that \u20ac10million plus was the starting ballpark potentially rising up to \u20ac15million. If, as would be expected, a significant number of backroom staff join Slot in making the move to Anfield.\"\n\nSlot Would Be a Good Addition at Liverpool Many have aired concerns but Slot is a top candidate\n\nWith Alonso and Amorim out of the picture, Slot has been analysed by many in the past few days and by playing a similar style to Klopp, it would mean that there would be less of a rebuild in the summer.\n\nWith Slot also likely to take his backroom staff to Anfield, his ideas and playing style would get across quicker, allowing Liverpool to hit the ground running at the start of next season. Of course, there will be some teething problems, but in terms of an immediate appointment that would fill fans with hope and continuity going forward, there wouldn't be many better than Slot to start with.\n\nStatistics courtesy of Transfermarkt. {"uri": "8094630481", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "09:53:57", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T09:53:57Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T09:53:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8313725590705872, "url": "https://www.givemesport.com/arne-slot-liverpool-manager-news-premier-league/", "title": "Arne Slot Ready to Move Family to Liverpool", "body": "Liverpool are looking to appoint a new manager to replace Jurgen Klopp in the near future, and Arne Slot has emerged as a candidate.\n\nHighlights Arne Slot, a candidate for Liverpool manager, is looking for houses on Merseyside to move his family to England. With an impressive track record at Feyenoord, Slot would bring silverware experience to the Reds. Slot is now pushing for a move to happen, with further talks planned this week.\n\nLiverpool are in the market for a new manager to replace Jurgen Klopp, with Feyenoord boss Arne Slot emerging as a candidate. According to Dutch outlet 1908, Slot has already started to look for houses in the Merseyside area, and he is preparing to take his family to the North West of England.\n\nKlopp announced that he would be heading through the exit door at the end of the season, giving the likes of Michael Edwards and Richard Hughes plenty of time to draw up a list of candidates, with Slot the latest name to be linked with the soon-to-be vacant position.\n\nSlot Looking for Houses in Liverpool He's prepared to move his family to Merseyside\n\nAccording to Dutch outlet 1908, Slot is already looking for houses in Liverpool and is looking to bring his family over to England. The report claims that the 45-year-old is now pushing to make the move happen, with his agent, Rafaela Pimenta now sitting down with the Merseyside club to discuss contract details, with further discussions planned this week.\n\nJournalist Ben Jacobs recently reported that Liverpool will intensify their pursuit of Slot this week with the situation moving fast. Time is running out before the end of the season, and the Reds will want a new manager in place as soon as possible so they can start to prepare for the upcoming summer transfer window.\n\nArne Slot vs Jurgen Klopp - Managerial Record\n\nStatistic\n\nArne Slot\n\nJurgen Klopp\n\nGames\n\n206\n\n1073\n\nWins\n\n127\n\n594\n\nWin %\n\n61.7%\n\n55.4%\n\nPoints-per-game\n\n2.06\n\n1.88\n\nSlot has enjoyed an impressive spell with Feyenoord over the last few years, reaching the Europa Conference League final in the 2021/2022 season before lifting the Eredivisie title the following year. The Dutch outfit also won the KNVB Cup earlier this term, so the 45-year-old coach is no stranger to silverware.\n\nThe Bergentheim-born manager has only managed in his home country so far in his career, which could be a concern for Liverpool due to his lack of experience elsewhere in Europe. It was a similar situation when they hired Klopp, though, with the former Borussia Dortmund boss only plying his trade in Germany.\n\nGIVEMESPORT Key Statistic: Arne Slot guided Feyenoord to their 16th Eredivisie title in history in 2023, and their first since 2017.\n\nRelated Who is Arne Slot - Dutch Manager Now Favourite For Liverpool Job A closer look at Arne Slot, the Dutch manager who has emerged as the new favourite to succeed Jurgen Klopp at Liverpool. Liverpool Want Arne Slot as First Choice He came close to joining Tottenham\n\nSpeaking on the Sky Sports Back Pages podcast, The Athletic reporter David Ornstein claimed that Slot is a strong candidate and he believes he is now the first choice for the Reds. The respected journalist adds that he came close to joining Tottenham Hotspur last summer, but ultimately decided against it.\n\nFeyenoord will be desperate to keep Slot after the impressive job he's done in the Eredivisie so far, but Liverpool appear to be ready to push to secure his signature.\n\nAll statistics in this article are courtesy of Transfermarkt (Correct as of 24/04/2024)", "source": {"uri": "8094678482", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "10:20:58", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T10:20:58Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T10:20:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8313725590705872, "url": "https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/13121957/arne-slot-liverpool-open-negotiations-with-feyenoord-about-possibility-of-hiring-dutchman-as-new-manager", "title": "Arne Slot: Liverpool open negotiations with Feyenoord about possibility of hiring Dutchman as new manager", "body": "Sky Sports News senior reporter Melissa Reddy says Feyenoord's Arne Slot is a 'very strong option' to replace Jurgen Klopp as Liverpool manager\n\nLiverpool have opened negotiations with Feyenoord about hiring Arne Slot as their new manager.\n\nSky Sports News reported on Tuesday that Slot is at the forefront of Liverpool's search for Jurgen Klopp's replacement.\n\nThe Feyenoord head coach ticks all their key criteria for the position and sources in Holland indicate the process could move quickly with the 45-year-old keen to join the Anfield club.\n\nCompensation is anticipated to be in the region of \u00a39m if a deal is to be closed.\n\nSlot, who secured the KNVB Cup last weekend and led Feyenoord to their first title in six years last season, appeals to Liverpool due to his aggressive, full-throttle style.\n\nHe has drilled his team to be adept at turning defensive actions into shooting opportunities and they top the Eredivisie for tackles won in the opposition's final third.\n\nFeyenoord have the best defence in the league and the second-best offensive metrics.\n\nSlot has proved capable of improving individuals as well as the collective, while operating on a smaller budget than his core competitors, and his penchant for a 4-2-3-1 or 4-3-3 formation fits Liverpool's squad.\n\nSlot has previously been approached by Tottenham, Chelsea and Leeds. He signed a new contract last May to keep him at Feyenoord until 2026 but has referenced a desire to make the next step in his career.\n\nSporting manager Ruben Amorim was under consideration by Liverpool but sources say he is no longer in the frame, as it stands.\n\nWest Ham are interested in Amorim but Julen Lopetegui, the former Wolves, Real Madrid and Spain boss, and Paulo Fonseca, currently in charge of Lille, are considered the frontrunners.\n\nSlot took over from Dick Advocaat at Feyenoord for the start of the 21/22 season with the club having finished fifth the previous campaign. Just two years later, they were champions of the Eredivisie. He built a pressing team playing intense, attack-minded football while also being able to win.\n\nFeyenoord are second behind PSV Eindhoven this season, nine points adrift with four games to play. In Europe they finished third in their Champions League group before dropping into the Europa League where they were knocked out by Roma on penalties in February.\n\nSpeaking to Sky Sports Dutch football journalist Marcel van der Kraan said: \"He is the prime candidate for Liverpool. It was only a matter of time before another big English club would come knocking on the door. He's not only been a successful manager, he's also been hugely impressive with his playing style of very attack-minded, Pep Guardiola-style football.\n\n\"I don't expect Feyenoord to stand in the way. They know he's a manager in demand but they will demand a big compensation fee. He has two years left on his contract that was a record deal.\n\n\"Never before in Dutch football has a team paid a manager such huge wages. The players like him, the fans love him, the club love him - they won't want him to go. Feyenoord have every right to demand a big fee as there is no clause in his contract which he renewed last year.\n\n\"He's been a successful coach and made Feyenoord champions playing crazy, sexy football. It is sexy what this man brings on a football pitch. There's nothing more to win for him here. The next step for him is to enter a club in a big league and no league is bigger for the Dutch than the Premier League. I will be surprised if Slot doesn't bite at this chance and become the manger of Liverpool next season.\"\n\nLast summer, Slot was one of the leading contenders for the then-vacant Tottenham manager's role and Sky Sports News reporter Gary Cotterill went to Rotterdam to cover the story.\n\nCotterill found Slot to be \"engaging, polite, very smiley, he's got presence and charisma - and he's funny\" when writing about his trip to get the lowdown on the Feyenoord boss, who has been open about his desire to manage in the Premier League.\n\n\"My next step will not be a club in Holland,\" he said in May 2023.\n\n\"If that is my next step, then I've failed completely. The normal next step will be to go abroad and I've always said the best league in the world is the Premier League.\"\n\nSpurs were determined to get Slot last summer after he secured the Eredivisie title with Feyenoord.\n\nHowever, Slot ruled himself out of the running to take over in north London before signing a new contract at Feyenoord a few days later which runs until 2026.\n\n\"I'm not done here yet,\" Slot said after the announcement of his new deal.\n\nThe potential deal with Spurs never got to any formal stage of discussions with him or Feyenoord and Spurs bosses felt that Slot used their interest in him to get an improved contract in the Netherlands.\n\nAnge Postecoglou was eventually appointed by Spurs from Celtic.\n\nEuropean football expert Andy Brassell told Sky Sports News:\n\n\"Slot is a guy who has got a consistent record of success and playing attacking football over several years. That idea of redeveloping teams and working with younger players as well is something that really appeals to Liverpool.\n\n\"The way he wants to attack would really appeal to Liverpool fans, too. He always wants his teams to find a way to put pressure on the opposition, to press, to score goals, and they do that in Europe as well.\n\n\"No one is quite like Jurgen Klopp in front of the media, but Slot is no shrinking violet at all. We've seen this when his side have played Roma and he's come up against Jose Mourinho. He's not afraid to upset and won't back down.\n\n\"Premier League clubs have known he would fit in well for quite a while. The Premier League has moved more towards possession and front-foot football, so it's probably the right time for Slot. Of course, there's a gap in quality compared to the Eredivisie, but he'll have better players at his disposal in the Premier League.\"", "source": {"uri": "skysports.com", "dataType": "news", "title": {"uri": "8092993553", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-23", "time": "11:15:51", "dateTime": "2024-04-23T11:15:51Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-23T11:15:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8313725590705872, "url": "https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/liverpool-jurgen-klopp-replacement-amorim-32651023", "title": "Liverpool told ideal Jurgen Klopp successor amid Ruben Amorim uncertainty", "body": "Liverpool are exploring other options after Ruben Amorim held talks with West Ham\n\nLiverpool have been urged to make a move for Arne Slot as their search for a new manager continues.\n\nIconic boss Jurgen Klopp will leave his role at Anfield at the end of the season after nine years in charge. In that time he has transformed the Reds into one of English football's top teams, winning the Premier League, Champions League, FA Cup and two Carabao Cups.\n\nKlopp announced his exit in January, with Liverpool having been searching for his successor ever since. That search has been hit by a number of blows, with frontrunner Xabi Alonso ruling himself out of the job.\n\nSporting Lisbon boss Ruben Amorim was seen as the next leading target, but he has been holding talks with West Ham around their manager's job instead. With Amorim having his eyes elsewhere, Slot has been touted as the ideal candidate.\n\nThe Dutchman has impressed with Feyenoord, leading them to the Eredivisie title last season and the KNVB Cup this year. His work has now led to Netherlands legend Marco van Basten selecting him as the top choice for the Reds.\n\n\"I think he's really good. I hope he stays in the Netherlands longer because it is an enrichment for Dutch football. He can really go anywhere - Bayern Munich, Liverpool... I'm really convinced of that,\" Van Basten told Ziggo Sport's 'Rondo'.\n\n\"I've spoken to him a few times and I think what he does and what he sees is very strong. He gets along very well with the group of players, is tactically well-versed, can explain things well and is calm and intelligent.\n\nHAVE YOUR SAY! Who should Liverpool appoint as their next manager? Comment below.\n\nThe Reds have been told Feyenoord boss Arne Slot would be the perfect successor to Jurgen Klopp\n\n\"I think he can go to any club, even at the very difficult clubs, because he is so intelligent. He has a lot of qualities and he shows it at every level. He first did it at AZ, and now at Feyenoord. And Feyenoord is a really complicated club.\n\n\"He has been doing well for three years, while PSV and Ajax have much more options in terms of money. He could really fit anywhere. If you get AZ and Feyenoord to play football, you also get big clubs like AC Milan to play football.\n\n\"You can clearly see his hand where he is the coach. I think it will even be easier for him at a higher level because he has better players who understand his ideas faster. I also think he is smart enough to manage stubborn players.\"\n\nSlot previously became a target for Tottenham before they chose Ange Postecoglou. He only signed a new three-year contract with Feyenoord last year and technical director Dennis te Kloese is confident he will remain in his post beyond the summer.\n\n\"I think it is logical that he is in such a good position,\" said Te Kloese via vi.nl. 'It is very special how he has manifested himself in recent years and has really given Feyenoord a face.\n\n\"We responded by extending his contract. In any case, we assume that he will also be our trainer next year. We have experienced this situation before and will take good care of our own interests.\"\n\nJoin our new WhatsApp community and receive your daily dose of Mirror Football content. He is the first choice of Fenway Sports Group chief Michael Edwards and incoming director of football Richard Hughes.\n\nSpeaking ahead of Feyenoord's match against Go Ahead Eagles on Thursday night, the 45-year-old told ESPN: \"I'd like to become new Liverpool manager, my decisions is clear. Feyenoord and Liverpool are in talks to negotiate, I'm waiting to see what will come out of it. I am confident, waiting for the clubs to reach an agreement.\"\n\nTalks are ongoing because Slot has two years left on his Feyenoord deal and it is understood it will cost around \u00a38.6million in compensation for Liverpool to hire him this summer. The Dutch club are consigned to losing their manager and have identified FC Twente boss Joseph Oosting as a target to replace him.\n\nSlot had earlier chosen to avoid answering questions about his links to Liverpool when he was approached by a reporter when getting off the team bus in Deventer. But, having failed to reach an agreement with Tottenham last summer, he appears destined for the Premier League.\n\nThat has always been the plan for the ambitious coach, who admitted last year: \"The next step will not be another club in Holland. If that is the next step, I've failed completely in the upcoming few years. A normal next step would be to go abroad and I've always said that the best league in the world is the Premier League.\"\n\nArne Slot will be waving goodbye to Feyenoord if all goes to plan\n\nHAVE YOUR SAY! {"uri": "8094972088", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "13:15:15", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T13:15:15Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T13:14:47Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8274509906768799, "url": "https://metro.co.uk/2024/04/24/arne-slots-tactics-see-liverpool-line-up-becomes-manager-20708017/", "title": "How Arne Slot's tactics could see Liverpool line-up under potential new manager", "body": "Arne Slot could become Liverpool's new manager this summer when Jurgen Klopp leaves - but how will the Reds line-up under the Dutchman at Anfield?\n\nLiverpool have made Slot their No.1 managerial target and have already opened talks with Feyenoord over brining him from the Eredivisie to the Premier League.\n\nThe 45-year-old wants to join Liverpool 'at all costs' after he rejected the Tottenham job last summer, with his stock rising after another impressive season.\n\nSlot led Feyenoord to the Dutch top-flight title last term while this campaign has seen his side clinch the KNVB Cup - and he has now moved ahead of Xabi Alonso, Ruben Amorim and Roberto De Zerbi on Liverpool's wishlist for a new boss.\n\nArne Slot ended his 18-year playing career in 2013 having featured for Dutch sides PEC Zwolle, NAC Breda, and Sparta Rotterdam as a midfielder.\n\nSlot, known for his passing and vision, 'behaved like a coach' in his final years as a player, according to his ex-teammate Bram van Polen.\n\nImmediately after hanging up his boots, he spent a year working as PEC Zwolle's youth coach before being handed an assistant coach role at Cambuur.\n\nDutch club Cambuur sacked their manager in October 2016 which saw Slot thrown in as a joint-interim boss, helping them climb from 13th to third.\n\nWith Slot in charge, Cambuur reached the KNVB Cup semi-finals for the first time in the club's history and impressively produced a victory over Dutch giants Ajax.\n\nThat saw AZ Alkmaar take a punt on Slot as an assistant manager - and he later took over as their main head coach for the 2019-20 campaign - as he became the first boss to win 19 points in his first eight top-flight games at the club.\n\nSlot earned 2.11 points per game at AZ in the Eredivisie - the highest of any coach in the club's history - with Feyenoord then snapping him up as manager in 2021.\n\nSlot has worked miracles at Feyenoord, guiding them to Eredivisie and KNVB Cup glory as well as a runner-up finish in the the inaugural Europa Conference League.\n\nIn 2023, his side beat Shakhtar Donetsk 7-1 for their biggest European win since 1995 as he became the first Feyenoord boss to have won 15 matches in Europe.\n\n'It was only a matter of time before another big English club would come knocking on the door,' Dutch journalist Marcel van der Kraan told Sky Sports.\n\n'He's not only been a successful manager, he's also been hugely impressive with his playing style of very attack-minded, Pep Guardiola-style football.\n\n'I don't expect Feyenoord to stand in the way. They know he's a manager in demand but they will demand a big compensation fee. He has two years left on his contract that was a record deal.\n\n'Never before in Dutch football has a team paid a manager such huge wages. The players like him, the fans love him, the club love him - they won't want him to go.\n\n'Feyenoord have every right to demand a big fee as there is no clause in his contract which he renewed last year.\n\n'He's been a successful coach and made Feyenoord champions playing crazy, sexy football.\n\n'It is sexy what this man brings on a football pitch. There's nothing more to win for him here.\n\n'The next step for him is to enter a club in a big league and no league is bigger for the Dutch than the Premier League. I will be surprised if Slot doesn't bite at this chance and become the manger of Liverpool next season.'\n\nLiverpool made Arne Slot a top target this week after evaluating a host of managers from around Europe.\n\nXabi Alonso was the original first-choice target before he announced his decision to remain with Bayer Leverkusen after guiding them to Bundesliga glory.\n\nSporting Lisbon's Ruben Amorim then emerged as a potential option - but he looks more likely to end up at West Ham.\n\nBrighton boss Roberto De Zerbi and Bologna's Thiago Motta were also linked but it is Slot who is now the frontrunner to replace Jurgen Klopp.\n\nArne Slot favours a high-intensity 4-2-3-1 formation in possession, which can be flexible to accommodate attacking players.\n\nHe prefers to have two deep-lying midfielders and a reliance on wingers to create chances.\n\nSlot's teams often dominate possession and play on the front-foot and are known for their pressing.\n\n'We are an attack-minded team that likes to have a lot of the ball, and we play with a lot of intensity,' Slot has said about his own style of football.\n\n'When we don't have the ball, we want to win it back as quickly as possible by being aggressive and pressing to win back possession. I think we are a team that is difficult to beat.'\n\nLiverpool's back four under Arne Slot is likely to have a very similar look, assuming none of their star defenders leave the club in the summer transfer window.\n\nMohamed Salah, though, has been strongly linked to the Saudi Pro League with West Ham star Jarrod Bowen tipped as one of his potential replacements.\n\nIt's been reported that Slot may decide to sign Atalanta's Teun Koopmeiners in one of his first decisions as Liverpool boss - who he managed at AZ Alkmaar.\n\nMORE : Liverpool to hold formal talks with Feyenoord as Arne Slot becomes No.1 choice\n\nMORE : Arsenal icon Paul Merson plays mind games with Liverpool and Man City", "source": {"uri": "metro.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "Metro"}, "authors": [{"uri": Reddy believes the compensation package Liverpool need to get Slot is around \u00a39m.\n\nDutch sources have indicated that Liverpool could 'quickly' confirm Feyenoord boss Arne Slot as Jurgen Klopp's successor, according to Sky Sports journalist Melissa Reddy.\n\nSlot has been heavily linked with a move to the Reds in the past 24 hours, following the news that previous favourite Ruben Amorim had reportedly been in talks with West Ham.\n\nThe Feyenoord manager has gained limited experience in his short career as a coach, but the Reds appear willing to take a chance on the 45-year-old.\n\nArne Slot Could Make Liverpool Move 'Quickly'\n\nAccording to Reddy, Dutch sources believe the former AZ Alkmaar manager could be confirmed as the new Reds boss swiftly.\n\nShe said on her X account:\n\n\"Liverpool have opened negotiations with Feyenoord over Arne Slot. Sources in Holland indicate the process could move quickly with the 45-year-old keen to join the Anfield club.\"\n\nThe Reds have known since January that Klopp will depart at the end of the campaign, following his nine-year spell at the club.\n\nIn terms of his potential successor, Slot has been a roaring success at Feyenoord.\n\nHe guided the Dutch giants to Eredevisie success last season, as well as taking his side to the UEFA Europa Conference League final, where they were defeated by Roma.\n\nSeason\n\nFeyenoord win % in Eredivisie under Slot\n\nLeague finishing position\n\n2021/22\n\n65%\n\n3rd\n\n2022/23\n\n74%\n\n1st\n\n2023/24\n\n73%*\n\n2nd*\n\n(Season ongoing)\n\nSlot's AZ and Feyenoord story so far\n\nSlot began his managerial career at AZ, where he initially worked as the club's assistant manager before taking up the role as the main man in charge.\n\nDuring his brief time at the club, he achieved an impressive points-per-game average of 2.11 - the highest of any coach in AZ's history.\n\nSlot took charge of Feyenoord at the start of the 2021/22 season and has gone on to implement a fluid and entertaining style of play, while picking up a couple of trophies along the way.\n\nFeyenoord are believed to respect Slot's wishes of leaving the club after nearly three seasons at the helm, in which he's brought great success to the Dutch giants.\n\n\"Relationship between Liverpool and Feyenoord is good with the Dutch club appreciative of the respect and discretion shown thus far,\" Reddy added.\n\n\"Feyenoord are also considerate of Slot's desire to make the next step of his career. Compensation anticipated to be in the region of \u00a39m.\"\n\nIf Slot is to join the Reds, he'd compete in the Premier League alongside fellow Dutch manager Erik Ten Hag, who is currently in charge of the Reds' famous rivals Manchester United.\n\nDe Zerbi and Amorim also linked with Liverpool\n\nBefore Slot's recent favouritism for being named the Reds' new manager, it was Amorim who held that crown.\n\nHowever, a recent report from David Ornstein revealed that the Sporting Lisbon boss has been in talks with the Hammers about taking over from David Moyes.\n\nLikewise, former Liverpool midfielder Xabi Alonso was long linked with a move to Merseyside.\n\nBut, after leading Bayer Leverkusen to their first-ever Bundesliga title, and this far going the whole season unbeaten, the Spaniard confirmed he will be staying put in Germany for another season at the very least.\n\nRelated Liverpool Tipped to Sign Kokcu if Arne Slot is Appointed Liverpool are pushing to appoint {"uri": "8094481216", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "08:25:45", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T08:25:45Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T08:25:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8274509906768799, "url": "https://www.givemesport.com/liverpool-manager-news-want-arne-slot-first-choice-replace-jurgen-klopp/", "title": "Arne Slot now first choice Jurgen Klopp replacement at Liverpool", "body": "Highlights Liverpool are eyeing up Feyenoord boss Arne Slot to replace Jurgen Klopp, with \u20ac10m (almost \u00a39m) compensation under discussion at Anfield. The Dutchman is a top candidate for the Reds, who are aiming to secure their next manager ahead of the 2024/25 season. Liverpool look to be in pole position to acquire Slot's signature, despite reported interest from Barcelona and Bayern Munich.\n\nLiverpool have made Feyenoord manager Arne Slot their first choice to succeed Jurgen Klopp in the dugout at Anfield this summer, according to The Athletic's David Ornstein, who was speaking on Sky Sports' Back Pages podcast.\n\nThe Reds have been on the lookout for a new head coach since Klopp privately informed the club of his decision to leave at the end of the 2023/24 season, in November 2023, before making the announcement public in January.\n\nSeveral names have been linked with the post, including Bayer Leverkusen's Xabi Alonso, and Sporting CP's Ruben Amorim, but attentions now seem to have been turned towards the Feyenoord boss. Slot has enjoyed a successful tenure in Rotterdam and could be set for a Premier League move this summer.\n\nSlot 'Definitely a Strong Candidate' for Liverpool Job The Feyenoord boss is in the running to replace Klopp at Anfield\n\nAccording to journalist Ben Jacobs, Liverpool's bid to appoint Feyenoord boss Arne Slot as Jurgen Klopp is 'moving fast'. Contact is expected with both the Eredvisie club and their manager, with compensation expected to be around the \u20ac10m (close to \u00a39m) mark. Speaking on Sky Sports' Back Pages podcast on 23rd April, The Athletic's David Ornstein claimed that Slot appears to be Liverpool's first choice appointment:\n\n\"He's definitely a strong candidate. I think he's gone to the top of the bookmaker's lists, and our information is that he appears to be the first choice now, and that's being reported in many of the papers. Arne Slot does have the credentials.\n\n\"He came very close, it seemed, to getting the Tottenham Hotspur job last summer. For whatever reason, he decided against it, and I think finances were also a bit of an issue in terms of paying what it takes, because I don't think there's a release clause in there. If they decide to go for him, that will be something Liverpool will have to get their head around. We've heard figures maybe even a little bit higher, and they will drive a hard bargain because they don't want to lose him.\n\n\"But hopefully, if they go forward with it, it will give the Liverpool fans and the club a little bit of clarity. It doesn't sound like a foregone conclusion, and they will have to talk further. I think there has been contact. Tonight [Tuesday], we're reporting on The Athletic between Liverpool and Slot, but it has not yet been between Liverpool and Feyenoord. So, there's a bit of a way to go yet.\"\n\nGIVEMESPORT Key Statistic: Slot's side have won 21 games out of a possible 29 throughout the 2023/24 Eredivisie season.\n\nLiverpool Make 'Direct Contact' With Slot The 45-year-old is considered an 'excellent' manager\n\nAccording to journalist Fabrizio Romano, Liverpool have made 'direct contact' with Slot ahead of potentially succeeding Jurgen Klopp in the Anfield dugout. The Dutchman is already considered an excellent manager with a style that could achieve 'special things' at the highest level in the Premier League.\n\nThe Italian claims that, despite reports that Slot has been on the radar of Barcelona and Bayern Munich, he is only aware of contacts with Liverpool as of now, putting the six-time European Cup winners in pole position to wrap up negotiations. Slot almost made the move to Tottenham Hotspur last year, but negotiations collapsed ahead of Ange Postecoglou's appointment in north London.\n\nAll statistics according to Transfermarkt, correct as of 24-04-24.\n\nRelated Liverpool Starting to Think About 'Formal Manager Interviews' Liverpool haven't appointed a new manager with Jurgen Klopp leaving but Ben Jacobs says that is pre-planned.", {"uri": "8094289776", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "06:18:05", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T06:18:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T06:17:53Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8274509906768799, "url": "https://www.firstpost.com/sports/football-news/liverpool-jurgen-klopp-arne-slot-13763140.html", "title": "Arne Slot favourite to replace Jurgen Klopp at Liverpool: British media", "body": "Feyenoord coach Arne Slot during a Europa League match. Reuters\n\nFeyenoord manager Arne Slot is the latest to be linked with the coaching job at Liverpool which will get vacant at the end of the season with Jurgen Klopp's departure. In fact, as per major British media houses, Slot is the favourite to replace Klopp at Anfield. Slot, 45, led Feyenoord to their first league title in six years last season and won the Dutch Cup on Sunday.\n\nHe had been a front runner to take over at Tottenham a year ago before ruling himself out of contention.\n\nSky Sports, the BBC and The Times all reported that Slot is now leading the race for the unenviable task of following Klopp at Anfield.\n\nHowever, the Reds could face competition from Bayern Munich and Barcelona, who are also looking for new coaches next season.\n\nBayer Leverkusen boss and former Liverpool midfielder Xabi Alonso had been the favourite when Klopp announced his decision in January to stand down at the end of the season after nearly nine years in the role.\n\nHowever, Alonso has committed to staying at Leverkusen after leading them to a first-ever Bundesliga title.\n\nSporting Lisbon coach Ruben Amorim was also linked with the Liverpool vacancy but reportedly held talks with West Ham on Monday about replacing David Moyes next season.\n\nSlot moved to Feyenoord in 2021 after impressing in his first managerial role at AZ Alkmaar.\n\nHe led the Dutch giants to the inaugural Europa Conference League final at the end of his first season, in which they narrowly lost 1-0 to Jose Mourinho's Roma.\n\nSlot then delivered just a second league title in 24 years to De Kuip last season, but his side trail PSV Eindhoven by nine points with only four games remaining in this year's Eredivisie title race.\n\nThe Times said his track record of improving players and a high-octane playing style, not dissimilar to Klopp's, is what is attracting the Liverpool hierarchy.\n\nKlopp has just five games left of a reign that has transformed Liverpool's fortunes after decades in the doldrums and could yet go out on the high by winning the Premier League.\n\nLiverpool sit behind Arsenal only on goal difference at the top of the table, but Manchester City have the destiny of the title in their own hands as they are just one point If that is the next step, I've failed completely in the upcoming few years.\n\n\"A normal next step would be to go abroad and I've always said that the best league in the world is the Premier League.\"\n\nThe attacking style of Slot, who is also thought to be interesting Barcelona and Bayern Munich, and his ability to develop players are believed to appeal to Liverpool.\n\nSlot became Feyenoord head coach in December 2020 after leaving AZ Alkmaar, where he enjoyed success in his first managerial position.\n\nThe former midfielder spent his entire playing career in the Netherlands, {"uri": "8093047521", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-23", "time": "11:50:22", "dateTime": "2024-04-23T11:50:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-23T11:50:07Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8235294222831726, "url": "https://www.givemesport.com/who-is-arne-slot-dutch-manager-now-favourite-for-liverpool-job/", "title": "Meet Arne Slot, the Dutch manager who is now the favourite for Liverpool job", "body": "A closer look at Arne Slot, the Dutch manager who has emerged as the new favourite to succeed Jurgen Klopp at Liverpool.\n\nHighlights Arne Slot has emerged as the favourite to succeed Jurgen Klopp at Liverpool ahead of the 2024-25 season. Slot has a successful track record in Dutch football, winning two trophies with Feyenoord in three years. The manager is highly regarded in the Netherlands, even drawing comparisons to Pep Guardiola, and could bring his attack-minded approach to Anfield.\n\nThere's a new favourite in the ever-changing race to succeed Jurgen Klopp as Liverpool manager for the 2024-25 season. Feyenoord's Arne Slot has emerged as the likely candidate to replace the German when he departs the Merseyside-based club in the summer.\n\nNothing is certain as Michael Edwards and Richard Hughes look to find the ideal replacement for Klopp, who has lifted the Premier League, Champions League and several cup competitions during his nine years at the club. Any boss that takes his place in the dugout will have their work cut out for them to try and live up to the high standards the former Borussia Dortmund manager has brought to Anfield.\n\nXabi Alonso was the name on everyone's lips in the immediate aftermath of the bombshell that Klopp would leave, but the Bayer Leverkusen boss has now been ruled out of the equation. The same goes for Sporting CP manager Ruben Amorim, who looked like the second most likely candidate before being ruled out of the running.\n\nThe new name at the front of the queue is Slot, who has done some incredible work in Dutch football over the past years. We've taken a closer look at the new leading candidate for the Anfield hot seat.\n\nArne Slot vs Jurgen Klopp - Managerial Record\n\nStatistic\n\nArne Slot\n\nJurgen Klopp\n\nGames\n\n206\n\n1073\n\nWins\n\n127\n\n594\n\nWin %\n\n61.7%\n\n55.4%\n\nPoints-per-game\n\n2.06\n\n1.88\n\nRelated How Many Liverpool Games Jurgen Klopp has Left The iconic manager could lead his side to a treble by the end of the season. Arne Slot's Background His rise in the managerial world has been fast\n\nAs a player, Slot enjoyed a respectable career, representing Eredivisie clubs such as NAC Breda and FC Zwolle. He was a midfielder with an eye for goal, netting over 100 times in his playing days. His name has gained much more recognition in the years since he hung up his boots, however, and Slot is now in contention for one of the top jobs in the world.\n\nHe retired in 2013 and took up a role as a coach at PEC Zwolle before moving on to become an assistant coach with SC Cambuur. During his first stint as a first-team boss, Slot was in with a chance of winning the Dutch top flight with his AZ Alkmaar side level on points with Ajax when the COVID-19 pandemic disrupted the season. As his side were behind on goal difference, they were declared as runners-up when the season was cancelled.\n\nAfter being found to be in discussions with Feyenoord in late 2020, he was sacked from his role at AZ Alkmaar, and he subsequently took over their Eredivisie rivals.\n\nSlot's Success at Feyenoord The Dutch boss has won two trophies in three years\n\nAlthough Feyenoord are set to lose out on the Eredivisie league title in the 2023-24 season, Slot has still been a huge hit since he arrived in Rotterdam in 2021. His debut campaign with the club saw the manager guide his new team into third place, as well as a European final.\n\nJose Mourinho's Roma defeated Feyenoord in the UEFA Europa Conference League final at the end of the 2021/22 season, but to have even gone that far in the competition was an achievement for the club in its own right.\n\nHis second full season was even more fruitful as Slot took his side to domestic glory despite losing nine of the players that lined up in the Conference League final the year before. That shows remarkable adaptability and the football he had his team playing was wonderful for the fans to witness. Feyenoord lifted the KNVB Cup earlier in the 2023/24 season, proving their manager is no stranger to silverware.\n\nGIVEMESPORT Key Statistic: Arne Slot guided Feyenoord to their 16th Eredivisie title in history in 2023, and their first since 2017.\n\nRelated The 10 Favourites to Replace Jurgen Klopp as Liverpool Boss (Ranked) Klopp's days at Anfield are coming to an end and there are a handful of interesting names linked with the job Slot is Highly Rated in the Netherlands He's drawn comparisons to Pep Guardiola\n\nWhile he may not be a known quantity to the majority of football fans across Europe, Slot is highly regarded in his homeland. This is shown by the comments from Dutch journalist Marcel van der Kraan in 2023, who claimed (per Sky Sports):\n\n\"He's a really good manager and sometimes it can come fast and quick. I've followed Feyenoord for 40 years. Not since the days of Johan Cruyff at Ajax in the 1980s has there been a coach so attack-minded in the Dutch league. Cruyff only had a few disciples who followed him and one of them was Pep Guardiola.\"\n\nTo be compared in any way to Cruyff and Guardiola is a compliment of the highest order and will be sure to excite Liverpool fans should Slot land the gig at Anfield. Van der Kraan continued to say: \"I would say Slot is a Guardiola-style manager based on everything I've seen over the past couple of years. The fans of Feyenoord can't believe what they've seen over that time.\"\n\nSlot was in the frame for the Tottenham job before Ange Postecoglou was eventually appointed by the north London side. The 2024-25 campaign could finally be the first time he steps foot in the English game. It will be a huge task to take the reins from Klopp, but Slot is someone who would back his ability to get a tune out of the talented squad he would be inheriting.\n\nAll statistics in this article {"uri": "8095373113", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "17:35:18", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T17:35:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T17:35:06Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8235294222831726, "url": "https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/13121957/liverpool-continue-slot-talks-after-feyenoord-turn-down-opening-offer", "title": "Arne Slot: Liverpool open negotiations with Feyenoord about possibility of hiring Dutchman as new manager", "body": "Kaveh Solhekol explains the details around Arne Slot's potential move to Liverpool and the type of football the fans can expect to see\n\nLiverpool remain in talks over appointing Arne Slot after Feyenoord turned down their opening offer for the manager.\n\nThe Premier League side made an approach worth \u00a37.75m for the 45-year-old but it is expected to cost Liverpool closer to \u00a39m if Slot is to become Jurgen Klopp's successor.\n\nSky Sports News reported on Tuesday that Slot is at the forefront of Liverpool's search.\n\nThe Feyenoord boss ticks all their key criteria for the position and sources in Holland indicate the process could move quickly, with the Dutchman keen to move to Anfield.\n\nSky Sports News senior reporter Melissa Reddy:\n\nTalks continue between Liverpool and Feyenoord for Slot to become Jurgen Klopp's successor.\n\nThere was an opening offer of \u00a37.75m which was turned down today by Feyenoord. That's totally normal because the first bid you make is usually just a negotiating starting point.\n\nMy understanding is the fee would need to be in the region of \u00a39m for the deal to be closed.\n\nSources in Holland early this morning were telling me they expect this process to move very quickly because of Slot's desire to manage Liverpool.\n\nThe fact the clubs are already discussing a financial agreement is quite significant. Moving quickly is an understatement here - wow, it has been rapid.\n\nNeither Feyenoord nor Liverpool want to provide minute-by-minute coverage of what's been happening in these talks but I'm told it's been very respectful. The relationship between the clubs is very good.\n\nUltimately, the reality is that Feyenoord want to keep Slot but they understand this is such a big opportunity and they can't really stand in his way. Their goal is to get the best price possible and potentially move that figure up to the \u00a310m mark.\n\nWhether they get there, we'll see.\n\nSlot, who secured the KNVB Cup last weekend and led Feyenoord to their first title in six years last season, appeals to Liverpool due to his aggressive, full-throttle style.\n\nHe has drilled his team to be adept at turning defensive actions into shooting opportunities and they top the Eredivisie for tackles won in the opposition's final third.\n\nFeyenoord have the best defence in the league and the second-best offensive metrics.\n\nSlot has proved capable of improving individuals as well as the collective, while operating on a smaller budget than his core competitors, and his penchant for a 4-2-3-1 or 4-3-3 formation fits Liverpool's squad.\n\nSlot has previously been approached by Tottenham, Chelsea and Leeds. He signed a new contract last May to keep him at Feyenoord until 2026 but has referenced a desire to make the next step in his career.\n\nSporting manager Ruben Amorim was under consideration by Liverpool but sources say he is no longer in the frame, as it stands.\n\nWest Ham are interested in Amorim but Julen Lopetegui, the former Wolves, Real Madrid and Spain boss, and Paulo Fonseca, currently in charge of Lille, are considered the frontrunners.\n\nSlot took over from Dick Advocaat at Feyenoord for the start of the 2021/22 season with the club having finished fifth the previous campaign.\n\nJust two years later, they were champions of the Eredivisie. He built a pressing team playing intense, attack-minded football while also being able to win.\n\nFeyenoord are second behind PSV Eindhoven this season, nine points adrift with four games to play. In Europe, they finished third in their Champions League group before dropping into the Europa League, where they were knocked out by Roma on penalties in February.\n\nSpeaking to Sky Sports, Dutch football journalist Marcel van der Kraan said: \"He is the prime candidate for Liverpool.\n\n\"It was only a matter of time before another big English club would come knocking on the door. He's not only been a successful manager, he's also been hugely impressive with his playing style of very attack-minded, Pep Guardiola-style football.\n\n\"I don't expect Feyenoord to stand in the way. They know he's a manager in demand but they will demand a big compensation fee. He has two years left on his contract.\n\n\"That was a record deal. Never before in Dutch football has a team paid a manager such huge wages.\n\n\"The players like him, the fans love him, the club love him - they won't want him to go. Feyenoord have every right to demand a big fee as there is no clause in his contract, which he renewed last year.\n\n\"He's been a successful coach and made Feyenoord champions playing crazy, sexy football. It is sexy what this man brings on a football pitch.\n\n\"There's nothing more to win for him here. The next step for him is to enter a club in a big league and no league is bigger for the Dutch than the Premier League.\n\n\"I will be surprised if Slot doesn't bite at this chance and become the manager of Liverpool next season.\"\n\nLast summer, Slot was one of the leading contenders for the then-vacant Tottenham manager's role and Sky Sports News reporter Gary Cotterill went to Rotterdam to cover the story.\n\nCotterill found Slot to be \"engaging, polite, very smiley, he's got presence and charisma - and he's funny\" when writing about his trip to get the lowdown on the Feyenoord boss, who has been open about his desire to manage in the Premier League.\n\n\"My next step will not be a club in Holland,\" he said in May 2023.\n\n\"If that is my next step, then I've failed completely. The normal next step will be to go abroad and I've always said the best league in the world is the Premier League.\"\n\nSpurs were determined to get Slot last summer after he secured the Eredivisie title with Feyenoord.\n\nHowever, Slot ruled himself out of the running to take over in north London before signing a new contract at Feyenoord a few days later which runs until 2026.\n\n\"I'm not done here yet,\" Slot said after the announcement of his new deal.\n\nThe potential deal with Spurs never got to any formal stage of discussions with him or Feyenoord and Spurs bosses felt that Slot used their interest in him to get an improved contract in the Netherlands.\n\nAnge Postecoglou was eventually appointed by Spurs from Celtic.\n\nEuropean football expert Andy Brassell told Sky Sports News:\n\n\"Slot is a guy who has got a consistent record of success and playing attacking football over several years. That idea of redeveloping teams and working with younger players as well is something that really appeals to Liverpool.\n\n\"The way he wants to attack would really appeal to Liverpool fans, too. He always wants his teams to find a way to put pressure on the opposition, to press, to score goals, and they do that in Europe as well.\n\n\"No one is quite like Jurgen Klopp in front of the media, but Slot is no shrinking violet at all. We've seen this when his side have played Roma and he's come up against Jose Mourinho. He's not afraid to upset and won't back down.\n\n\"Premier League clubs have known he would fit in well for quite a while. The Premier League has moved more towards possession and front-foot football, so it's probably the right time for Slot.\n\n\"Of course, there's a gap in quality compared to the Eredivisie, but he'll {"uri": "8093284464", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-23", "time": "14:21:23", "dateTime": "2024-04-23T14:21:23Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-23T14:21:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8196078538894653, "url": "https://www.irishmirror.ie/sport/soccer/liverpool-jurgen-klopp-replacement-amorim-32651659", "title": "Liverpool told ideal Jurgen Klopp successor amid Ruben Amorim uncertainty", "body": "Liverpool have been urged to make a move for Arne Slot as their search for a new manager continues.\n\nIconic boss Jurgen Klopp will leave his role at Anfield at the end of the season after nine years in charge. In that time he has transformed the Reds into one of English football's top teams, winning the Premier League, Champions League, FA Cup and two Carabao Cups.\n\nKlopp announced his exit in January, with Liverpool having been searching for his successor ever since. That search has been hit by a number of blows, with frontrunner Xabi Alonso ruling himself out of the job.\n\nSporting Lisbon boss Ruben Amorim was seen as the next leading target, but he has been holding talks with West Ham around their manager's job instead. With Amorim having his eyes elsewhere, Slot has been touted as the ideal candidate.\n\nThe Dutchman has impressed with Feyenoord, leading them to the Eredivisie title last season and the KNVB Cup this year. His work has now led to Netherlands legend Marco van Basten selecting him as the top choice for the Reds.\n\n\"I think he's really good. I hope he stays in the Netherlands longer because it is an enrichment for Dutch football. He can really go anywhere - Bayern Munich, Liverpool... I'm really convinced of that,\" Van Basten told Ziggo Sport's 'Rondo'.\n\n\"I've spoken to him a few times and I think what he does and what he sees is very strong. He gets along very well with the group of players, is tactically well-versed, can explain things well and is calm and intelligent.\n\nHAVE YOUR SAY! Who should Liverpool appoint as their next manager? Comment below.\n\n\"I think he can go to any club, even at the very difficult clubs, because he is so intelligent. He has a lot of qualities and he shows it at every level. He first did it at AZ, and now at Feyenoord. And Feyenoord is a really complicated club.\n\n\"He has been doing well for three years, while PSV and Ajax have much more options in terms of money. He could really fit anywhere. If you get AZ and Feyenoord to play football, you also get big clubs like AC Milan to play football.\n\n\"You can clearly see his hand where he is the coach. I think it will even be easier for him at a higher level because he has better players who understand his ideas faster. I also think he is smart enough to manage stubborn players.\"\n\nSlot previously became a target for Tottenham before they chose Ange Postecoglou. He only signed a new three-year contract with Feyenoord last year and technical director Dennis te Kloese is confident he will remain in his post beyond the summer.\n\n\"I think it is logical that he is in such a good position,\" said Te Kloese via vi.nl. 'It is very special how he has manifested himself in recent years and has really given Feyenoord a face.\n\n\"We responded by extending his contract. In any case, we assume that he will also be our trainer next year. We have experienced this situation before and will take good care of our own interests.\"\n\nJoin our new WhatsApp community and receive your daily dose of Mirror Football content. {"uri": "8095159622", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "15:10:04", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T15:10:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T15:09:48Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8196078538894653, "url": "https://sports.yahoo.com/liverpool-open-talks-feyenoord-over-142408920.html", "title": "Liverpool to open talks with Feyenoord over Slot", "body": "Liverpool are set to open talks with Feyenoord on Wednesday over manager Arne Slot as they search for Jurgen Klopp's successor.\n\nKlopp announced in January he would leave Anfield at the end of the season and the Reds have been conducting extensive research around a number of candidates.\n\nSlot, who led Feyenoord to the 2022-23 Eredivisie title, has emerged as a candidate who fits Liverpool's criteria.\n\nFeyenoord have won the Dutch Cup this season and are second in the Eredivisie.\n\nSlot was linked with Leeds United after they sacked manager Jesse Marsch in February 2023.\n\nHe then ruled himself out of contention for the Tottenham Hotspur job last summer before Ange Postecoglou took over.\n\nThe 45-year-old then extended his contract with Feyenoord until 2026.\n\nIf Liverpool do want to appoint Slot, they will have to negotiate a fee with Feyenoord as he does not have a release clause for this summer. There is one in his contract but it can't be activated until next year.\n\nAt the time he was being linked with Spurs, Slot said: \"The next step will not be another club in Holland. If that is the next step, I've failed completely in the upcoming few years.\n\n\"A normal next step would be to go abroad and I've always said that the best league in the world is the Premier League.\"\n\nThe attacking style of Slot, who is also thought to be interesting Barcelona and Bayern Munich, and his ability to develop players are believed to appeal to Liverpool.\n\nHe became Feyenoord head coach in December 2020 after leaving AZ Alkmaar, where he enjoyed success in his first managerial position.\n\nThe former midfielder spent his entire playing career in the Netherlands, making more than 100 appearances for both FC Zwolle and NAC Breda.\n\nXabi Alonso was linked with the Anfield job but the former Reds midfielder announced in March he would stay on at Bayer Leverkusen, who have since become German champions.\n\nSporting Lisbon boss Ruben Amorim is another manager heavily linked with the Liverpool job.\n\nAfter retiring from playing, Slot began his coaching career as a youth coach at PEC Zwolle before moving to SC Cambuur to become an assistant manager.\n\nHe moved to AZ Alkmaar in 2017 and stepped up to become manager two years later. In his first season in charge, they were second, level on points with leaders Ajax, when the Covid-19 pandemic brought the season to a premature end.\n\nHe was sacked in December 2020 when it emerged that he had been negotiating with Feyenoord.\n\nSlot took charge of Feyenoord in the summer of 2021 and has managed 144 games at the Rotterdam club, winning 93, drawing 27 and losing 24.\n\nOf his 98 league games, he has won 69 - giving him an impressive win percentage of 70.4%.\n\nHis career win percentage from more than 200 games across all competitions is 61.8%.\n\nHe won the Eredivisie with the club in 2022-23 and triumphed in the Dutch Cup this season.\n\nIn a June 2023 interview with the Athletic, Slot said about staying with Feyenoord: \"I want to work longer on the project to see what comes from that, because you can every time leave somewhere after one or two successful seasons but, in the end, where and what are you then?\n\n\"So sometimes you also have to cherish what you have. There's more to life and to football than only winning a prize.\n\n\"It is also the way you work. It's not always that you come into the place where you can work like we can here and be happy, professional-wise but also family-wise.\"", "source": {"uri": "sports.yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8095094411", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "14:29:49", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T14:29:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T14:28:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8196078538894653, "url": "https://www.sportsmole.co.uk/football/liverpool/news/liverpool-learn-arne-slot-compensation-fee_542074.html", "title": "Liverpool 'learn Arne Slot compensation fee'", "body": "Liverpool reportedly learn how much they would have to pay to appoint Feyenoord manager Arne Slot as their next boss. Liverpool have reportedly established what they will need to pay to appoint Arne Slot as their new manager.\n\nThey Merseyside giants have spent the last three months assessing their options on the back of Jurgen Klopp announcing that he will depart his role at Anfield at the end of the season.\n\nSoon after Xabi Alonso committed his future to Bayer Leverkusen, it appeared that Sporting Lisbon's Ruben Amorim was the most likely successor to the German.\n\nHowever, in recent days, the Portuguese has dropped down the pecking order, with Feyenoord boss Slot seemingly emerging as a strong candidate.\n\nReports have indicated that Liverpool have already held discussions with the 45-year-old as they bid to find Klopp's successor before the end of the current campaign.\n\n\u00a9 Reuters\n\nWhat would Liverpool have to pay?\n\nOn the back of rejecting Tottenham Hotspur's interest in the past, Slot was presented with the opportunity to extend his contract at De Kuip until 2026.\n\nNevertheless, it has been widely suggested that there was no release clause included in those terms, giving Feyenoord the leeway to set their own asking price.\n\nAccording to the Daily Mail, the Dutch giants are prepared to give the green light to an exit for Slot for \u20ac10m (\u00a38.59m).\n\nThe report acknowledges that Slot is interested in making the switch to Anfield and Feyenoord are open to allowing their successful head coach make the move to the Premier League.\n\n\u00a9 Reuters\n\nWhy could Slot be viewed as the right man to replace Klopp?\n\nSlot had impressed at AZ Alkmaar before he eventually moved to Feyenoord, but his time in Rotterdam has only exceeded expectations.\n\nA total of 94 wins and just 23 defeats have come during 146 matches in all competitions, Slot having won an Eredivisie title and KNVB-Beker trophy as well as reaching the 2021-22 Europa Conference League final.\n\nAlthough Feyenoord have been outclassed by PSV Eindhoven during the current campaign, they still have 72 points from 30 games, scoring 77 goals in the process.\n\nHis style of play is also not too dissimilar to that of Klopp's the hope seemingly being that will help with the transition from a manager who has spent eight-and-a-half years at the helm.\n\nWhile other managers have been linked with the soon-to-be vacant position, it appears that Liverpool are ready to be proactive in appointing Slot as their next boss.\n\nID:542074:1false2false3false:QQ:: from db desktop :LenBod:collect4642:", "source": {"uri": "sportsmole.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "Sports
