{"uri": "8095463402", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "18:48:32", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T18:48:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T18:48:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7019608020782471, "url": "https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/jame-carragher-arne-slot-liverpool-29055494", "title": "Jamie Carragher shares Arne Slot concern which Klopp has created at Liverpool", "body": "Jamie Carragher has given his verdict on Arne Slot emerging as the leading contender to replace J\u00fcrgenKlopp at Liverpool. The Reds and Feyenoord are in talks over a deal to see the Dutchman take over at Anfield next season.\n\nSlot has become the front-runner after Xabi Alonso and R\u00faben Amorim were previously heavily linked with the unenviable job of replacing Klopp. And Carragher believes there is a notable \"lack of real top managers\" available to his former club.\n\nHe raised some concerns over Slot needing to make a \"huge jump\" to be a success - and that is largely due to the job Klopp has done making it a vastly different job opportunity than it was when the German first took over back in 2015.\n\nREAD MORE:Arne Slot sent Liverpool message by managerial rival Reds don't want\n\nREAD MORE:Virgil van Dijk has already raved about assistant Arne Slot could bring with him to Liverpool\n\nCarragher said on Sky Sports ahead of Liverpool's clash with Everton at Goodison Park: \"What I would say from Feyenoord to Liverpool is a huge jump, and I think it shows in this moment a lack of real top managers out there when you look at who Liverpool were going for.\n\n\"Initially probably Xabi Alonso but it was only his first full season as a manager. There was talk of Amorin from Sporting Lisbon but he's only 39. Now Arne Slot looks like he is the favourite right now.\n\n\"I don't think it's like Rafa Benitez coming in or Jurgen Klopp coming in. Benitez came off the back of winning two La Liga titles and a UEFA Cup and Jurgen Klopp coming after winning a couple of titles with Borussia Dortmund and getting to a Champions League final.\n\n\"Liverpool were in a different space then, and that was a Liverpool team under Rafa Benitez that I was part of that was trying to qualify for the top four, the same with Jurgen Klopp when he came in. Liverpool are in a different area now and fancy themselves to challenge for the Premier League next season and the Champions League, they will be expected to reach the quarter-finals at least.\n\n\"I think it is a huge jump, he's obviously a great coach and has a good track record with the clubs he has had so far, so we will see.\"\n\nWhile Carragher has some concerns, his former teammate, Sander Westerveld, believes Slot is a \"perfect fit\" for his former club. Westerveld, who played alongside Slot at Sparta Rotterdam, told Sky Sports: \"Well, first of all, I hope something happens very quickly, because I've been giving interviews about Xabi Alonso, how good he was, and last week it was all about the Portuguese (Ruben Amorim).\n\n\"Now it's Arne Slot, and in fact I played for him when I played for Sparta Rotterdam. {"uri": "8097051931", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-25", "time": "15:53:31", "dateTime": "2024-04-25T15:53:31Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-25T15:53:04Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7019608020782471, "url": "https://www.tbsnews.net/sports/arne-slots-philosophy-could-suit-liverpool-says-virgil-van-dijk-836596", "title": "Arne Slot's philosophy could suit Liverpool, says Virgil Van Dijk", "body": "Klopp will leave Anfield at the end of this season and Slot has emerged as the leading candidate to replace the German.\n\nLiverpool captain Virgil van Dijk said Arne Slot's attacking tactics could be the ideal match for the Premier League club if the Feyenoord boss wins the race to succeed Jurgen Klopp.\n\nKlopp will leave Anfield at the end of this season and Slot has emerged as the leading candidate to replace the German.\n\nLiverpool are reportedly in talks with Slot over a potential move to Merseyside and Van Dijk has expressed his support for his fellow Dutchman's football philosophy.\n\n\"I find it hard to answer of course, but I think Arne Slot is perhaps one of the better Dutch coaches at this moment,\" Van Dijk told Viaplay, following Liverpool's 2-0 defeat at Everton on April 24.\n\n\"I think the way of playing and the philosophy he has, that he could be a Liverpool coach.\n\n\"Only I think from what I read and hear is that it's still far from being completed. We shall see.\"\n\nIf Slot is picked to take over from Klopp, who led Liverpool to the Premier League title in 2020 and won the Champions League in 2019, he will likely have to lift a team that is set to finish this season on a low note.\n\nLiverpool's loss at Merseyside rivals Everton left them three points behind leaders Arsenal with four games left.\n\nThird-placed Manchester City will retain the title if they win their last six matches.\n\nAfter quarter-final defeats in the FA Cup and Europa League, Klopp's farewell season is becoming a damp squib and Van Dijk admitted they don't deserve to win the title.\n\n\"Games likes these, the bare minimum is fight. We were lacking that at so many moments in games,\" Van Dijk said, after the Everton defeat.\n\n\"If you play like we did, obviously even if we create two or three clear-cut chances again, you don't deserve to win the league.\n\n\"It's crunch time and we've not been good enough in the way we finished the chances off, in the way we defended together and also the fight. I think we have to show much more.\n\n\"But we have to look in the mirror and each and every one of us has to think like 'listen, you can't accept this. You can't accept the way we let our season end'.\"\n\nAfter Bayer Leverkusen manager Xabi Alonso ruled himself out as a potential candidate to replace Klopp, Slot is the front runner and his CV suggests he could make an impact in the Premier League.\n\nSlot was a leading candidate to take charge at Tottenham in 2023r before opting out of the race as Ange Postecoglou eventually joined the north Londoners.\n\nEmploying an attacking game-plan, Slot led Feyenoord to the Dutch title in 2023 and won the Dutch Cup this season.\n\nFeyenoord are currently second in the Eredivisie, nine points The German made it known earlier this year that he'd be leaving before the end of his contract following a successful spell on Merseyside - with attention turning to who may replace him.\n\nLiverpool have considered household names and upcoming managers during their search. Slot is now near the front of the queue following his exploits with Feyenoord, where he's claimed the Eredivisie title and the Dutch Cup.\n\nSlot though didn't want to add any fuel to the fire when he was asked about the prospect of moving to the Premier League to succeed Klopp at Anfield several months ago. He said: \"What answer can I give that there will be no headlines about it? So next question!\"\n\nEnglish clubs have pursued Dutch coaches in the past - Manchester United doing so recently with Erik ten Hag. The 45-year-old is highly thought of, hence why he was on the radar of Tottenham when they were looking for a new manager, before eventually staying where he was.\n\nAt the time he was being linked with the north Londoners, he said: \"The next step will not be another club in Holland. If that is the next step, I've failed completely in the upcoming few years. A normal next step would be to go abroad and I've always said that the best league in the world is the Premier League.\"\n\nFeyenoord have only lost twice in the league this term, but are second to PSV. We responded by extending his contract. In any case, we assume that he will also be our trainer next year. We have experienced this situation before and will take good care of our own interests.\"\n\nWhen Klopp first announced his departure Xabi Alonso was tipped to be his replacement, but the Spaniard has won the Bundesliga title and pledged his loyalty to Bayer Leverkusen. His side have conceded just 23 times in 30 matches but even more impressively has 15 clean sheets.\n\nSlovakian international D\u00e1vid Hancko has been an ever-present this season. His agent Branislav Jasurek revealed in January that talks had been held with the Reds and PSG.\n\nThat move didn't materialize but he told TN that Feyenoord may be willing him this summer for a significant profit, with Hancko valued at around $48m (\u00a339m/\u20ac45m). He will not go from Feyenoord, who is going to play in the Champions League, to a club in the bottom half of the Premier League.\"\n\nHancko needn't worry about that if Liverpool is to reignite its interest. We are left asking who succeeds the German tactician after he transformed Liverpool from a club looking from the outside to arguably England's finest.\n\nBetMGM sign-up offer: Get \u00a340 in free bets when you bet \u00a310\n\nNot signed up to BetMGM yet? For more information, visit begambleaware.org\n\nThere will be no shortage of candidates, but the fan's choice, Xabi Alonso, will not undertake what must be deemed an unenviable task. Alonso, who guided Bayer Leverkusen to a first Bundesliga title and breaking Bayern Munich's relentless 11-year monopoly, has decided to remain in Germany, overseeing the club's forthcoming Champions League campaign.\n\nAnother potential candidate, R\u00faben Amorim, could end up at West Ham after potentially guiding Sporting CP to a second Portuguese championship in three seasons. Amorim's present deal in Lisbon expires this summer, which cannot be said for Slot, who is set to remain at the Rotterdam giants until June 2026 after extending his contract last year following heavy coverage of succeeding Antonio Conte as Tottenham's full-time head coach.\n\nHowever, despite staying, Van Basten feels Slot -- linked with the vacant Anfield job -- is ready to leave the Netherlands and can set up at several European powerhouses, including Liverpool.\n\n\"I think Slot is really good. I hope he stays in the Netherlands longer because it enriches Dutch football,\" he told Ziggo Sport.\n\n\"He can really go anywhere: Bayern Munich, Liverpool... I'm convinced of that. I hope he stays in the Netherlands, but I am convinced he can do it anywhere. I've spoken to him a few times, and he handles the players very well. Of course, he is also very well-versed tactically.\n\n\"I can explain his ideas well; he is calm and intelligent. He is a top trainer. I think he can go to any club, even difficult clubs. He is very smart in his choice of words.\"\n\nA returning Michael Edwards will undertake the search for Klopp's replacement. Having worked as Liverpool's sporting director between 2016 and 2022 and returned earlier this year as their chief executive of football.\n\nEdwards, renowned for utilising a cutting-edge team of data analysts and scouts, could raise an eyebrow when looking at Slot's numbers.\n\nFor one, when looking across Europe's top seven leagues since Arne Slot took charge of Feyenoord in July 2021, there are two Klopp-esque metrics he matches or is in the ballpark of. The first concerns the most possession won in the final third: Feyenoord boasts 722, with Liverpool not far behind with 706. Secondly, when it comes to most points from losing positions, both teams are level (62).\n\nThat is not to say Slot is a Klopp regen. From a tactical perspective, he's a 4-2-3-1 guy, with Klopp (ironically) opting for an orthodox 4-3-3, which Dutch coaches often favour.\n\nOnce concluding a modest, nearly two-decade playing career, the former midfielder was soon appointed Cambuur interim manager before AZ gave him a full-time deal. One season in Alkmaar was enough to convince Feyenoord, and Slot would quickly turn their fortunes around. Building on a third-placed finish, Slot ended the club's six-year championship drought, and he's likely to claim a runners-up spot this season after winning the club's 14th Dutch Cup.\n\nWhoever takes over from Klopp would represent a huge gamble, but the next manager will inherit a battle-hardened squad with the right combination of youth and experience. The former speaks to a coach of Slot's calibre. The native of Bergentheim can be described as a 'teacher', someone best suited to a squad needing guidance. One could argue Liverpool post-Klopp requires a 'people's manager' who can deal with a more experienced group of players.\n\n\"I really think it is the perfect moment for a new manager and not the wrong one because we didn't win everything, we left spaces,\" Klopp said last month.\n\n\"Go at City after Pep Guardiola and you need to be champion 10 years in a row to achieve the same! Maybe it was good for that reason that we didn't become champion with 97 points.\n\n\"The people here are different. The people gave Bill Shankly the chance, and what came after Bill Shankly, and they are all bigger than we are, and the people will understand in the end that this was a fantastic time and we all It was just the little things with the personal life, not my family around, the Corona situation. So it was a bit tough. {"uri": "8094619768", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "09:47:43", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T09:47:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T09:47:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6980392336845398, "url": "https://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/arne-slot-liverpool-mohamed-salah-32658430", "title": "Liverpool line up under Arne Slot could see Salah sold and three big transfers", "body": "Feyenoord boss Arne Slot is now being tipped as the favourite to succeed Jurgen Klopp as Liverpool manager this summer.\n\nThe market for a new manager is teeming with potential candidates, as clubs like Bayern Munich, Barcelona and Liverpool conduct their own search, leading to probable shifts in preference by the coming summer.\n\nHowever, Liverpool see Slot as a fitting option owing to his coaching philosophy and playing style that aligns closely with Klopp's strategies, the Mirror reports.\n\nREAD MORE: Meet Arne Slot - what he offers Liverpool, inside his philosophy, and how much he'd cost\n\nREAD MORE: Arne Slot's Feyenoord press conference cancelled as link to Liverpool job emerges\n\nThis article contains affiliate links, we will receive a commission on any sales we generate from it. Learn more Watch football, F1, golf, tennis, cricket and more Get all the sport you could ever ask for\n\nSky Sports is bringing you 500 live football games to watch, as well access to Cricket, Golf, F1, Boxing, NFL, NBA and more across eight dedicated channels. Sky Sports is the only way to watch all the action this year.\n\n\u00a322 a month\n\nSky Get it here\n\n\"We are an attack-minded team that likes to have a lot of the ball, and we play with a lot of intensity,\" Slot described his approach at Feyenoord in an interaction with UEFA. \"When we don't have the ball, we want to win it back as quickly as possible by being aggressive and pressing to win back possession. I think we are a team that is difficult to beat\".\n\nDespite nearly securing a spot at Tottenham last May, disagreements over financial terms with Feyenoord resulted in the appointment of Ange Postecoglou. Besides his theoretical fit, the 45-year-old Dutchman boasts trophy-winning records - he bagged the Eredivisie title last season and clinched the Dutch Cup this term.\n\nShould Mohamed Salah be sold by Liverpool this summer? Give us your thoughts in the comments section below\n\nSpeculating his potential transition to Merseyside, Daily Star Sport takes a dive into what his arrival could imply for Liverpool's team. Firstly, Slot's formation is clear: a 4-2-3-1 in possession, which can be flexible to accommodate attacking talent.\n\nHe played it with AZ Alkmaar and Feyenoord and wouldn't need to change much at Liverpool, who play in a similar 4-3-3 formation under Klopp.\n\nLiverpool's backline has been disrupted by injuries this season, with Alisson, Trent Alexander-Arnold, Ibrahima Konate and Andy Robertson all spending time on the sidelines, but if fully fit they are likely to continue as the first-choices next season, alongside Virgil van Dijk.\n\nIt is further forward where changes could be made. To play a 4-2-3-1 formation, Slot would perhaps like to sign an attacking midfielder, because other than Dominik Szoboszlai, the Liverpool squad is lacking a player capable.\n\nThat could give Slot the excuse for a reunion with Teun Koopmeiners, who Liverpool know all too well. Koopmeiners has enjoyed an exceptional season with Atalanta and was part of the side which stunned the Reds with a 3-0 win at Anfield earlier this month.\n\nThe 26-year-old has 11 goals and four assists in Serie A so far this season and has played primarily as an attacking midfielder. Slot is a known fan, having coached him during the 2019/20 campaign at AZ Alkmaar.\n\nSlot is also a massive admirer of Santiago Gimenez, the Feyenoord striker who has netted 24 goals and provided seven assists in 40 games this season. The 23-year-old is already being touted as a potential transfer target across Europe this summer and could follow his current boss to Anfield.\n\nDarwin Nunez has had a successful season, but his inconsistent finishing and Diogo Jota's injury woes suggest a new striker might be a good addition this summer.\n\nThis brings us to the big issue: Mohamed Salah. The Liverpool legend is contracted until June 2025, but the allure of Saudi Arabian wealth hasn't disappeared and is likely to resurface in the summer transfer window.\n\nLiverpool will undoubtedly want to retain Salah, who shows little sign of slowing down at 31 years of age, but they're not in a particularly strong position. They'll either need to sell for the highest price, tie him down to a new contract, or risk losing him for free next summer.\n\nWest Ham's Jarrod Bowen and Wolves' Pedro Neto have been frequently linked with Liverpool and both remain targets. With Michael Edwards back on board with Fenway Sports Group and Richard Hughes coming in as the new sporting director, the Reds won't be short of scouting expertise but both of these players are known quantities.\n\nNeto has struggled with injuries this season and Bowen has shown a real eye for goal in 2023/24, netting 19 times in all competitions, so he gets the nod.\n\nLiverpool's possible XI He also reached the inaugural Europa Conference League final in his first season in charge after replacing Dick Advocaat.\n\nLiverpool's search for Klopp's successor is being driven by Michael initial frontrunner but, after committing his immediate future to the new Bundesliga champions Bayer Leverkusen, the Anfield club has considered numerous alternatives, including Sporting's R\u00faben Amorim, who is wanted by West Ham, and Brighton's Roberto De Zerbi.\n\nLiverpool's targets had been sounded out via intermediaries since Klopp publicly announced his shock departure in January and He led the Rotterdam club to the inaugural Europa Conference League final in his first season, when they finished third in Eredivisie, won the league title in his second season and lifted this season's KNVB Cup on Sunday with a 1-0 victory over NEC Nijmegen.\n\nSlot record and playing style has attracted widespread interest, including from Tottenham last season, and Liverpool could face competition from Barcelona, Bayern Munich and Milan for his services this summer, when he will have two years remaining on the contract he extended with Feyenoord last May.\n\nXabi Alonso had been the frontrunner for the Liverpool vacancy but committed himself to Bayer Leverkusen shortly before leading the club to the first Bundesliga title in their history. {"uri": "8094949715", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "13:02:19", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T13:02:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T13:02:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6941176652908325, "url": "https://www.rousingthekop.com/2024/04/24/a-risk-dutch-journalist-describes-what-worries-him-about-arne-slot-moving-to-liverpool/", "title": "'A risk'... Dutch journalist describes what worries him about Arne Slot moving to Liverpool", "body": "At this moment in time, it looks very likely that Arne Slot will be Liverpool's next manager, but according to one journalist, it could be a 'risk' for the Reds.\n\nA little over 24 hours ago, few Liverpool fans will have been an expert on Arne Slot. The 45-year-old Dutchman has become the frontrunner for the Liverpool job seemingly out of nowhere.\n\nBut with the latest developments surrounding his situation, it now seems very likely that Slot will be Jurgen Klopp's successor.\n\nLiverpool have clearly made their choice and are now looking to accelerate the deal to get things wrapped up, before any other team swoops in ahead of them.\n\nClearly Slot's move is not just a major topic in Liverpool circles at the moment but also back home in the Netherlands.\n\nSlot has developed an affable reputation in his homeland. He is highly regarded for the work he has done at Feyenoord and AZ Alkmaar.\n\nBoth clubs' supporters adored him during his stints. His demeanour and playing style appeals to fans, and that will make him a popular figure at Liverpool.\n\nAlthough there is no denying his appointment would come with some risks. Dutch journalist Sjoerd Mossou has highlighted this as well.\n\n\"It seems great to me: Arne Slot at Liverpool. Wonderful, we would like to follow that.\" Mossou said on the podcast Algameen Dagblad.\n\n\"I do believe that you can work in an excellent organization at Liverpool. That is a club where every coach wants to work. I especially wonder whether they would dare to do it, with a trainer of Slot's stature, with a trainer that no one knows.\n\n\"That has been done before in the past, and has often proven to be a good choice, but it has also failed sometimes. There is certainly a risk when you take a trainer who comes from the middle bracket of Europe.\n\n\"He can vary and he is able to adapt and pivot matches. If you analyze Slot down to the last decimal point, and what he has done with this material, because let's not forget, they are of course good players by Dutch standards, but they are not European top, then we can conclude that he is a good trainer is. But that seems pretty crazy to me. The question is more: how high is he on everyone's list?\"\n\nMichael Edwards and the data team will have done their research. Slot clearly seems to be their favoured candidate.\n\nBut there are so many variables that data cannot account for. The reality is nobody would have been a guaranteed success to come in after Jurgen Klopp.\n\nAny manager would have been a risk, given the current market. Even Xabi Alonso, who would have been many peoples' favoured candidate.\n\nYou just got to have faith it works out. There is definitely great potential in Slot. If he can get things right, this could be another really entertaining period for Liverpool.", "source": {"uri": "rousingthekop.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Rousing The Kop"}, "authors": {"uri": "8097231435", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-25", "time": "18:06:52", "dateTime": "2024-04-25T18:06:52Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-25T18:06:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6941176652908325, "url": "https://www.the-star.co.ke/sports/2024-04-25-slot-the-control-freak-inspired-by-guardiola/", "title": "Slot, the 'control freak' inspired by Guardiola", "body": "Doing well in the Dutch Eredivisie does not guarantee success in the Premier League, but the Liverpool hierarchy must be confident that Arne Slot can continue his fine achievements in England.\n\nHe has constantly over-achieved with his teams in the Netherlands so far. Just ask Dutch legend Marco van Basten, who has been hugely impressed with his work.\n\n\"I think he is that good,\" the former striker told Rondo, a Dutch talk show on Ziggo Sport. \"He could end up anywhere. Bayern Munich, Liverpool, you name it. I'm convinced of that.\"\n\nLiverpool could well be that club, as Slot has impressed them with his attacking blend of football, constantly pressing opponents high up the field -- reminiscent of the football played at Anfield under Jurgen Klopp.\n\nJust like the German manager, Slot is prepared to take that approach against anyone. A telling example was Feyenoord's Champions League match at Atletico Madrid earlier this season.\n\nTheir intensity helped them achieve seven shots on target, a total last bettered by a visiting side against Atletico in the Champions League when Real Madrid managed eight in 2015, according to Opta.\n\nThis season was Feyenoord's first Champions League campaign in six years, but they excelled in winning the ball high up the pitch, resulting in dangerous situations.\n\nIn their six group matches, they won the ball back 59 times in the last 40 metres of the pitch in open play, with only four teams doing that more often.\n\nSlot's teams play well in possession, and his players overlap to provide an extra layer of unpredictability. \"I've spoken to him a few times and what he does and what he sees is very good,\" explains Van Basten. \"He gets on with the squad very well, is tactically very astute, can explain things well and is calm and intelligent.\n\n\"I think he can go to any club, yes. Even to the very difficult clubs, because he is so intelligent.\"\n\nApart from his tactical expertise and meticulous preparations, Slot is also good at building a team with modest resources.\n\nSeven players who started the 2022 Europa Conference League final defeat by Roma left Feyenoord that summer. Slot, though, built a team with recruits such as Santiago Gimenez, Sebastian Szymanski and Mats Wieffer - all for nominal fees - who would prove pivotal in securing a first Dutch title in six years.\n\nLast summer, again, they lost important players in Szymanski and Orkun Kokcu, but have had a strong season once more, winning the Dutch Cup last Sunday.\n\nFeyenoord spent around \u00a330m on players in each of the past two campaigns, whereas Ajax have had an outlay of almost \u00a3100m in each of theirs. On top of that, Slot gives young talent a chance.\n\nQuinten Timber -- twin brother of Arsenal's Jurrien -- and Quilindschy Hartman have developed very well under his tutelage and become pillars of the team, with both making their debut for the Dutch national team this season as well.\n\nSlot is inspired by Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola, studying every small detail.\n\n\"I certainly don't want to compare myself to Pep, but he is a control freak just like me,\" Slot said in an interview with Voetbal International in May 2023.\n\n\"If I look at myself, I try to win a match in the week before it is played, by conveying the training, pre-match team talks and tactics to the players as perfectly as possible.\"\n\nHe said previously watching Guardiola's teams gives him the \"ultimate joy in football\". \"There is no team in the world I would rather watch than Manchester City, followed by Napoli, Arsenal and Brighton,\" added Slot.\n\n\"But City - and again it is not my intention to compare us with them - have a similar style of play to how we want to play with Feyenoord: 4-3-3, building up from the back, wanting to apply pressure quickly.\"\n\nLast season, Leeds and Crystal Palace were said to be interested and Tottenham were very keen on his services, but Slot opted to stay in the Netherlands, where he had just won the title and was looking ahead to guiding Feyenoord in the Champions League. Van Basten doesn't think a move to the Premier League would be a step too high.\n\n\"If you get AZ and Feyenoord to play (good) football, you will also get the big clubs to play good football,\" says Van Basten.\n\n\"I think it would only become easier for him because you have better players who understand quicker what you want. Those players are also more stubborn, but I think Slot is smart enough to manage that.\"\n\nArne Slot led Feyenoord to the Eredivisie title in 2022-23\n\nThe Dutchman has a calm and balanced approach, which works well with his players and was highlighted in one of his post-match dressing room talks last season.\n\nAfter Feyenoord beat rivals Ajax for the first time away in the league in 17 seasons, a video released by the club showed Slot talking about the importance of the weeks to come.\n\n\"Because this is only a win. It's not more than a win, it's a big win, but it's not more than a win,\" said Slot in the video. \"We have a bigger goal this season than only winning for the first time in 17 years in Amsterdam. Our goal is bigger than that.\"\n\nFeyenoord duly went on to clinch the league title.\n\nThis year they are in good form again and could even get a higher points tally than last season's 82, but PSV's impressive form means they will probably have to settle for second, which would still guarantee Champions League football.\n\nNow Slot could be set to embrace another rivalry, this time with a manager he so admires in Guardiola. The Dutch boss would say bring it on.", "source": {"uri": "the-star.co.ke", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Star"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arne_Slot", {"uri": "8096242503", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-25", "time": "07:30:52", "dateTime": "2024-04-25T07:30:52Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-25T07:30:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6941176652908325, "url": "https://www.rousingthekop.com/2024/04/25/jamie-carragher-gives-his-honest-verdict-about-arne-slot-becoming-liverpools-next-manager/", "title": "Jamie Carragher gives his honest verdict about Arne Slot becoming Liverpool's next manager", "body": "Jamie Carragher has opened up about his honest thoughts on Arne Slot, who could become Liverpool's next manager.\n\nAt this moment in time, it looks like everything is pointing in the direction of Arne Slot. The 45-year-old Dutchman is Liverpool's favourite candidate to succeed Jurgen Klopp.\n\nBarring a last-minute change in circumstances, it would be a surprise if Slot wasn't appointed by Liverpool. Although, we have seen that happen recently, not just in the club's managerial pursuit but with the transfers of Moises Caicedo as well.\n\nSlot is an interesting character. He is well liked in the Netherlands and has enjoyed a lot of success at Feyenoord. It will be tough to follow in Klopp's footsteps, though.\n\nBut the reality is replacing Klopp was going to be a really tough task for any manager. Slot with his affable character seems like he has the mentality to make the step-up.\n\nAlthough, naturally, there will be question marks about whether he is truly ready to take on the challenge at Anfield.\n\nSpeaking on Sky Sports on Wednesday night, Jamie Carragher voiced those concerns about Slot.\n\n\"What I would say is that I think from Feyenoord to Liverpool is a huge jump,\" Carragher said.\n\n\"I think it shows that at this moment there is a dearth of real top managers out there when you actually look at who Liverpool are going for, someone initially like Xabi Alonso, who is only in his first full season as a manager.\n\n\"There was talk of Amorim from Sporting Lisbon, again he's 39. And now Arne Slot looks like he's the favourite right now. So, yeah I don't think it's like Rafa Benitez or Jurgen Klopp coming in, when Rafa Benitez came on the back of winning two La Liga titles, or Jurgen Klopp coming in winning a couple of league titles with Borussia Dortmund, next to a Champions League final.\n\n\"And Liverpool were actually in a different space then. That was a Liverpool team, certainly with Rafa Benitez that I was part of. We were trying to qualify for the top four, same with Jurgen Klopp when he came on.\n\n\"But Liverpool as I said they're in a different area now, they're actually fancying themselves to challenge in the Premier League every season and next season's Champions League, they expect to go to the quarter-finals at least.\n\n\"So I think it's a huge jump but obviously a great coach, got a great track record with the clubs that he had so far, with AZ Alkmaar and Feyenoord, but yeah we'll see.\"\n\nCarragher is right to have some doubts about Slot taking over from Jurgen Klopp. However, there is a lot to admire about the Dutchman as well.\n\nHe's a more innovative coach with fresh ideas, and he's got a great character as well. When you are looking at the current managerial market, there are few out there who play with a great brand of attacking football and who have the character that he does as well.\n\nSo, all in all, he might just be Klopp's perfect replacement. I hope he stays in the Netherlands longer because it is an enrichment for Dutch football,\" he told Dutch TV channel Ziggo Sports.\n\n\"He can really go anywhere... Bayern Munich, Liverpool... I'm really convinced of that.\n\n\"I've spoken to him a few times and I think what he does and what he sees is very strong.\n\n\"He gets along very well with the group of players, is tactically well-versed, can explain things well and is calm and intelligent.\n\n\"I think he can go to any club, even at the very difficult clubs, because he is so intelligent.\"\n\nFormer Netherlands midfielder Wim Jonk told the same channel: \"He (Slot) gave Feyenoord a face. Arne has made enormous strides. {"uri": "2024-04-333050587", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-23", "time": "19:56:19", "dateTime": "2024-04-23T19:56:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-23T17:19:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6941176652908325, "url": "https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/liverpool-arne-slot-playing-style-29047728", "title": "Arne Slot's playing style: What Liverpool could expect from next boss contender", "body": "With one of the most heavily debated topics in world football currently concerning who will succeed J\u00fcrgen Klopp at Liverpool, fans may have finally been presented with their answer. Feyenoord's Arne Slot may not be the most glamorous name in the European game but his credentials could make him an intriguing proposition for the powers that be at Anfield.\n\nSince the current incumbent in the L4 hotseat announced his intentions to depart his post at the end of the season, the lack of tangible movement in terms of his successor has seen a cloud of uncertainty drift over proceedings on Merseyside. However, supporters may finally have now edged closer to the clarity they so crave over who will assume the reins next.\n\nBayer Leverkusen's Xabi Alonso had appeared the obvious candidate until he decided to commit his future to the recently-crowned German champion. Even as speculation still swirls that Sporting's R\u00faben Amorim could be installed as Klopp's successor, the latest link with apparent newly-installed frontrunner Arne Slot may spell the beginning of the end of the saga.\n\nREAD MORE: How good is Arne Slot? Feyenoord record assessed for leading next Liverpool manager candidate\n\nREAD MORE: Who is Arne Slot? 'Leading candidate' to be next Liverpool manager is 'like Pep Guardiola'\n\nSlot is under consideration and is among the leading candidates. An Eredivisie title winner, he certainly ticks one box in terms of his credentials when it comes to overseeing domestic league success.\n\nMoreover, with the current Liverpool roster very much shaped in the image of Klopp, Reds fans will be encouraged to learn that they will see a lot of similarities in how Slot sets up his teams to the current manager. Here at Liverpool.com, we have compiled together a summary of what to expect from Slot, with a focus on his tactics, philosophy, and his personality...\n\nFormation\n\nPreviously the head coach at AZ Alkmaar, the current Feyenoord boss has garnered a reputation in his homeland for his high-intensity, attacking teams, which he normally sets up in a 4-2-3-1 formation. Although this is a slight variation on what Klopp has gone with during his eight seasons at Liverpool, the use of the box midfield with a defensive midfielder has been deployed by the German for the majority of this term.\n\nWith Trent Alexander-Arnold often stepping into the midfield as a quarterback of sorts, he has evolved to become an auxiliary midfielder from his regular berth at right-back. Usually, this means that the club vice-captain has had Wataru End\u014d or Alexis Mac Allister sitting in the No. 6 role to allow him the freedom to influence the attack.\n\nMoreover, Slot's usage of wingers to try and engineer chances certainly does seem to fit with the philosophy employed by Klopp, who normally uses Luis D\u00edaz and Mohamed Salah to feed a central striker. Having taken over from Dick Advocaat with the team having finished in fifth place in the previous campaign, Feyenoord was crowned champion within two seasons using this approach. In short, the i has described his approach as \"high-energy attacking football in a 4-3-3 or 4-2-3-1 with two deep-lying midfielders and a reliance on wingers to create chances\".\n\nPhilosophy\n\nAs for his general philosophy, Slot's teams often are comfortable dominating possession, while playing on the front foot in terms of the attack. In a word, Slot's teams have been characterized by their intensity. The statistics back this up too, with the current Dutch champion very similar in terms of its approach and mentality to what one has come to expect from Liverpool.\n\nIn fact, since Slot took over at Feyenoord, its pressing has been the most successful of any team across the continent's top seven leagues, with the Rotterdam club outperforming only Liverpool in this respect with 722 interceptions to 706. Moreover, Feyenoord lead the way in terms of points won from losing positions with 62 -- coincidentally, level with the Reds.\n\nSpeaking previously to UEFA, the current De Kuip helmsman said: \"We are an attack-minded team that likes to have a lot of the ball, and we play with a lot of intensity. When we don't have the ball, we want to win it back as quickly as possible by being aggressive and pressing to win back possession. I think we are a team that is difficult to beat.\"\n\nLikewise, a tactical analysis from Coaches Voice, stated that the coach does not \"overcommit to the high press,\" while reverting \"into a more reserved block\" if they fail to win the ball.\n\nPersonality\n\nAs for Slot's personality, there are even more parallels to be drawn with the departing Liverpool manager, with the Dutchman known for his bubbly and amusing outlook. According to a previous Sky Sports profile he is known for being \"engaging, polite, very smiley\", while he also boasts \"presence and charisma,\" while being \"funny\".\n\nHowever, he does also seem to have the ability to pull rank with his troops if they are in need of a reminder of the standards expected. Dennis van Eersel, of Dutch national TV channel RTV, previously said of Slot: \"He can be angry with his players, of course but he also puts his arm around them. They like him because he's built a harmony at the club.\"\n\nSpeaking to Sky Sports, the man from the Netherlands admitted that he has ambitions of managing in England one day. Tellingly, he asserted: \"My next step will not be a club in Holland. If that is my next step, then I've failed completely. The normal next step will be to go abroad and I've always said the best league in the world is the Premier League.\"", "source": {"uri": "liverpool.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Liverpool"}, {"uri": "8096862098", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-25", "time": "13:50:22", "dateTime": "2024-04-25T13:50:22Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-25T13:49:56Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6941176652908325, "url": "https://punchng.com/five-things-to-know-about-liverpool-linked-arne-slot/", "title": "Five things to know about Liverpool-linked Arne Slot", "body": "Feyenoord coach, Arne Slot, who is reportedly the subject of talks about joining Liverpool, is known as a passionate leader who gets the most out of his players and demands a strong work ethic.\n\nA fan of Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola, Slot was a slick forward player with a reputation as an accurate passer of the ball -- so much so he has a move named after him.\n\nHere are five key facts about the 45-year-old who could succeed Jurgen Klopp at Anfield.\n\n- Arne Slot Pass -\n\nSlot joined PEC Zwolle as a 17-year-old striker known more for his technique than his running.\n\n\"Many people thought Arne was lazy and phlegmatic. But that wasn't right. You just shouldn't expect sliding tackles,\" his former coach Jan Everse told public broadcaster NOS.\n\nBut \"silky\" and \"cultured\" are words often used to describe his playing style, and PEC Zwolle still employ the \"Arne Slot Pass,\" says former teammate Bram van Polen.\n\nThe Arne Slot Pass is a slight deflection from a forward with his back to goal which splits the defence and releases a winger running off the ball.\n\n- Dressing room style -\n\nLiverpool fans looking for clues to their potential future boss's style have started sharing a rousing team talk he gave Feyenoord players after an historic victory at Ajax.\n\n\"The reason why we are where we are today is because you work your ass off every single day. And that's the reason you could beat this team in their own stadium, without even our fans being here,\" he told the dressing room.\n\n\"But it's only a win. It's a big win, but we have a bigger goal this season than winning for the first time in 17 years in Amsterdam,\" Slot said to cheers from the team.\n\n- Spurs links -\n\nThe interest from Liverpool is not the first time Slot has attracted Premier League clubs. He was heavily linked with Tottenham during their troubled search to replace Antonio Conte in May 2023.\n\nAs Spurs were reportedly about to seal the deal, Slot abruptly walked out, signing a new contract instead with Rotterdam-based Feyenoord.\n\n\"The decisive factor was playing in the Champions League... the fact that I am having a great time privately and being able to build on the past two seasons,\" said Slot at the time.\n\nFeyenoord's Champions League campaign got off to a strong start with a 2-0 home win against Celtic, but two defeats against Atletico Madrid sealed their fate, and they finished third in Group E.\n\n- Guardiola fan -\n\nThe British press have already dubbed Slot the \"Dutch Pep Guardiola\" for the high-pressing attacking style much beloved by Feyenoord fans.\n\nSlot certainly admires the legendary Spanish coach of Manchester City, who would be among his top rivals if he did join Liverpool.\n\nIn several interviews, he has cited Guardiola as his role model, telling the Algemeene Dagblad (AD) last year: \"Players always look very good under him. And the same players seem worse with managers before and after him.\"\n\n- Run, run, run -\n\nAs a coach, Slot is known for a fierce work ethic, driving to Feyenoord's camp before dawn, watching every training session, and obsessively studying future opponents.\n\n\"I say to Feyenoord: you have to ensure that you create four times as many chances as your opponent and work twice as hard,\" Slot told the AD.\n\n\"In all the matches that we have won this season, we see in the data that we have run 20 or 30 percent more than the opposition. Matches we didn't win: only three or six percent more.\"\n\n\"Every training, every meeting must be spot on,\" he said.\n\nThis has led to results on the pitch at Feyenoord, seen as a team with physically fit players who work hard for each other and often score late goals.\n\nSlot appears to have cultivated this work ethic as a manager, rather than when he was a player.\n\n\"He wants his boys to be fit... he didn't have that before. I don't know if he has ever seen the inside of a weights room,\" said former teammate Van Polen.", "source": {"uri": "punchng.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Punch Newspapers"}, "authors": [], But that wasn't right. You just shouldn't expect sliding tackles,\" his former coach Jan Everse told public broadcaster NOS.\n\nBut \"silky\" and \"cultured\" are words often used to describe his playing style, and PEC Zwolle still employ the \"Arne Slot Pass\", says former teammate Bram van Polen.\n\nThe Arne Slot Pass is a slight deflection from a forward with his back to goal which splits the defence and releases a winger running off the ball.\n\nLiverpool fans looking for clues to their potential future boss's style have started sharing a rousing team talk he gave Feyenoord players after a historic victory at Ajax.\n\n\"The reason why we are where we are today is because you work your ass off every single day. {"uri": "8094394586", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "07:31:15", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T07:31:15Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T07:30:55Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6941176652908325, "url": "https://www.rousingthekop.com/2024/04/24/arne-slot-already-wants-to-bring-staff-member-virgil-van-dijk-really-likes-with-him-to-liverpool/", "title": "Arne Slot already wants to bring staff member Virgil van Dijk really likes with him to Liverpool", "body": "Liverpool have reportedly chosen Feyenoord's Arne Slot as the man to become their new manager.\n\nSlot had not initially seemed likely to be in the running to take over from Jurgen Klopp this summer.\n\nHowever, the Dutchman was outed on Tuesday as Liverpool's preferred choice to follow Klopp at Anfield. With things now reportedly set to 'move fast,' it really looks like the Reds have found their man.\n\nFor Liverpool fans, there will be mixed emotions no doubt. Finding a successor for Jurgen really brings it home once again that the big man is really leaving. And although he's obviously a talented coach, there are perhaps some concerns that the step up will be too big for Slot.\n\nJust as it has been for Klopp, it will be vital that his replacement has a good coaching team around him. Pep Lijnders has been crucial to everything good about Liverpool in recent years and by the sounds of things, Slot has has his very own Lijnders lined up.\n\nKlopp's entire first-team staff have always been influential to everything he's achieved at Liverpool. It will be strange to see many of them leave the club with him.\n\nBut, with the new man coming in, it's important that he brings people with him who can help him to succeed.\n\nAnd with that in mind, Slot is reportedly already preparing to assemble his team for the Reds.\n\nTaking to X last night, journalist Dominic King claimed that the Dutchman will look to bring his current assistant manager at Feyenoord, Sipke Hulshoff, with him.\n\n\"Arne Slot update: he would be prepared to bring his assistant Sipike Hulshoff with him to Liverpool if the move deal gets done,\" King reports. \"It is absolutely clear now Slot is preferred candidate at this stage.\"\n\nPlenty of Liverpool supporters may not have even heard of Slot before the last couple of days, so they won't be expected to know his assistant either.\n\nBut, as it turns out, some at Anfield are already very aware of Hulshoff. The 49-year-old combines his duties at Feyenoord with also being Ronald Koeman's assistant for the Netherlands national team.\n\nObviously, there he will have come into contact with Liverpool's Dutch trio of Cody Gakpo, Ryan Gravenberch and - more importantly - captain Virgil van Dijk. Van Dijk has publicly praised Hulshoff in the past, raving about his tactical strength to Voetbal International last year.\n\n\"Of course, I didn't know Sipke Hulshoff at all before this,\" says the Liverpool captain. \"You have to get to know each other. You can see what his qualities are and I personally like that. Hopefully he can continue that. He is very clear and tactically strong. I like the moments when he leads a training session. I think I also speak on behalf of the group. We're only four days in, but it's a good start.\"\n\nKnowing the captain will surely be a big boost for Hulshoff is he does indeed come in. {"uri": "8096987250", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-25", "time": "15:09:24", "dateTime": "2024-04-25T15:09:24Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-25T15:09:05Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6901960968971252, "url": "https://www.rousingthekop.com/2024/04/25/steve-nicol-says-hes-really-not-sure-arne-slot-is-the-right-manager-for-liverpool/", "title": "Steve Nicol says he's really 'not sure' Arne Slot is the right manager for Liverpool", "body": "Liverpool look ready to move a step closer to hiring Arne Slot as their new manager.\n\nThe Reds have been on the lookout for the right man to replace Jurgen Klopp for the past three months.\n\nAnd although the likes of Ruben Amorim have previously appeared to be favourites, Slot has now emerged as the clear front-runner.\n\nHaving had a bid for the 45-year-old rejected by Feyenoord on Wednesday, Thursday brought news that FSG are continuing to negotiate in order to find an agreement. It doesn't look a million miles away.\n\nSince the news of Slot's ascension broke on Tuesday, plenty of pundits have been weighing in on how he will fare at Liverpool, including Jamie Carragher. So far, much of the tone has been slightly sceptical, and Reds legend Steve Nicol now follows that same view.\n\nSuch is Klopp's status at Liverpool, that it was always going to be a difficult job for whoever follows him at Anfield.\n\nAs a result, the incoming manager needs to have an incredibly strong personality. Slot appears to tick that box - as well as plenty of others.\n\nBut according to Nicol, while the Dutchman may be well equipped in some ways to handle Liverpool, his limited coaching experience makes him a big gamble.\n\n\"Underwhelmed,\" the 62-year-old told ESPN when asked for his response to Slot being installed as top candidate.\n\n\"I mean, is that the resume of somebody to lead Liverpool back to the Premier League title and the Champions League? I can't honestly say that.\n\n\"All the other boxes have been ticked. The way they play the game, the way he goes about it. You know he's going to be able to coach but is it really a resume to take over one of the biggest clubs in the land? I'm not sure it is. But what are the alternatives.\"\n\nAlthough Slot is quite clearly now Liverpool's choice here, there is still a chance that it all goes belly up.\n\nAs reported on Tuesday, there are potentially other top teams in for the former AZ Alkmaar manager as well. It isn't a done deal. Consequently, Liverpool need to keep other options ready just in case they're needed.\n\nOne of them could still be Amorim, despite his talks with West Ham this week. Those negotiations were reportedly intended to put pressure on Liverpool to make a decision.\n\nIf an agreement can't be reached with Feyenoord then the Sporting boss would still look the most likely Despite setting up in the same 4-2-3-1 shape, he has at times included an extra player, pressing high with a front three - both man for man against a back three or against a back four.\"\n\nShould he take charge at Anfield, Slot is likely to utilise his tactic of a double pivot in midfield, playing in front of a back four with attacking full-backs.\n\nAlisson would almost certainly keep his place in goal, while Liverpool's record-breaking full-back duo of Andy Robertson and Trent Alexander-Arnold likely start on the flanks.\n\nReds captain Virgil van Dijk would start in central defence, possibly alongside Ibrahima Konate.\n\nAlexis Mac Allister, arguably the club's player of the season, would start as one of the two holding midfielders - potentially alongside a new No 6 signing - Mats Wieffer.\n\nThe versatile Dutchman has previously been linked with Liverpool and could be a potential bargain, having scored six goals in 42 games for Feyenoord this season.\n\nIn the 4-2-3-1 formation, Dominik Szoboszlai would be pushed forward into the No 10 role.\n\nCody Gakpo could get the nod over Luis Diaz on the left, given Slot's familiarity with him from their time against each other in the Eredivisie, while Salah would likely play on the right if he still remains at Anfield next season.\n\nDarwin Nunez could get the nod over injury-prone Diogo Jota up front, although Slot It's believed that negotiations with both the club and the manager are ongoing.\n\nSlot himself is said to be very keen to take the job, according to Sky Sports, so it's expected the process could move quickly once Liverpool finalizes a deal with Feyenoord. The approach so far has shown the utmost respect, coming as it did after the weekend's victorious KNVB Cup final.\n\nThat's essentially it in terms of Feyenoord's season, with PSV able to mathematically claim the title as early as tomorrow. Slot's side has a 12-point margin to third with four games to play, so is more or less guaranteed to end the season as runner-up.\n\nREAD MORE: Four things 'definitely' happen if Liverpool hires Arne Slot including transfers and formation\n\nREAD MORE: Virgil van Dijk has already raved about assistant Arne Slot could bring with him to Liverpool\n\nThat does beg one question: why aren't the Reds after the man finishing first? PSV has enjoyed a near-faultless campaign akin to that of Xabi Alonso at Bayer Leverkusen, winning 26 of 30 league games and losing just once.\n\nSuch a question was put to PSV manager Peter Bosz in light of the links between Liverpool and Slot. But the 60-year-old laughed it off (via Dutch outlet FC Update).\n\n\"That didn't happen [a Liverpool approach], did it? I'm having a great time here, so just let me sit here!\"\n\nBosz, who has had stints with Borussia Dortmund, Bayer Leverkusen and Lyon, also had a message for his rival Slot. He talked up the \"fantastic\" opportunity:\n\n\"It would be fantastic for Arne. Liverpool is of course a big club, if it all works out and it would, then that would be great for him. He is more than welcome.\"\n\nDespite the plethora of names linked, Bosz has never emerged as a candidate for Liverpool during the hunt for Klopp's heir. Slot himself has come somewhat out of left-field, but looks to be moving ever closer to the role.\n\nLiverpool.com says: PSV is having a wonderful season, and will be confirmed as champion ahead of Feyenoord soon. But Liverpool will have looked at a wide variety of factors.\n\nThere are obvious concerns about Bosz's record elsewhere, with a succession of big clubs outside of the Netherlands ultimately dispensing of his services. Perhaps more importantly, Slot's second place this season is a significant overperformance compared to financial resources, something FSG is bound to value highly.\n\nIt's also only fair to note that Slot did lead Feyenoord to a league title last season, upsetting the relative stranglehold possessed by Ajax and PSV over the last two decades. leave Feyenoord for Liverpool", "body": "PSV Eindhoven boss Peter Bosz says it would be 'fantastic' to see Arne Slot take charge of Liverpool, insisting the Feyenoord manager 'more than deserves it'.\n\nSlot, 45, has emerged as the frontrunner to take over the reins from Jurgen Klopp in the summer, with 'serious negotiations' taking place between Richard Hughes, Liverpool's newly appointed sporting director, and Feyenoord in recent days.\n\nFeyenoord are believed to be holding out for a compensation fee of \u20ac10million (\u00a38.5m) from the Merseyside giants for their head coach, who steered the club to their first league title in six years last season.\n\nFormer Liverpool midfielder Xabi Alonso had initially been identified as the first-choice candidate to succeed Klopp, but the Spaniard effectively ruled himself out of the running by committing his immediate future to Bayer Leverkusen last month.\n\nSlot, who was heavily linked with Tottenham before Ange Postecoglou's move to north London, is said to be desperate to manage the Reds, eager to push through a move to Anfield 'at all costs'.\n\nThe Dutchman guided Feyenoord to KNVB Cup glory with victory over NEC Nijmegen at the weekend and will be determined to finish the Eredivisie campaign on a high, with the side trailing leaders PSV by nine points with four games remaining.\n\nSpeaking ahead of PSV's trip to Heerenveen on Thursday night, Bosz was quizzed on the speculation surrounding Slot and claimed it would be 'great' to see his fellow countryman make the step up and manage Liverpool.\n\n'It would be fantastic for Arne,' the PSV head coach told reporters.\n\n'Liverpool is, of course, a big club and if it all works out, then that would be great for him.\n\n'He more than deserves it.'\n\nBosz laughed off the suggestion that Liverpool should be chasing him instead of Slot considering PSV's nine-point lead over Feyenoord in the Dutch top flight.\n\n'I'm having a great time, so just let me sit here!' he responded.\n\nDutch football icon Marco van Basten is confident has the qualities necessary to succeed at a club of Liverpool's stature.\n\n'I think he's really good,' Van Basten said of Slot on Ziggo Sport.\n\n'I hope he stays in the Netherlands longer because it is an enrichment for Dutch football. He can really go anywhere - Bayern Munich, Liverpool... I'm really convinced of that.\n\n'I've spoken to him a few times and I think what he does and what he sees is very strong. He gets along very well with the group of players, is tactically well-versed, can explain things well and is calm and intelligent. I think he can go to any club, even at the very difficult clubs, because he is so intelligent.\n\n'He has a lot of qualities and he shows it at every level. He first did it at AZ, and now at Feyenoord. And Feyenoord is a really complicated club. He has been doing well for three years, while PSV and Ajax have much more options in terms of money.\n\n'He could really fit anywhere. If you get AZ and Feyenoord to play football, you also get big clubs like AC Milan to play football. You can clearly see his hand where he is the coach.\n\n'I think it will even be easier for him at a higher level because he has better players who understand his ideas faster. other reliable reporters have echoed that sentiment.\n\nIt is understood Tottenham were interested in the coach last summer, but complications, including Feyenoord's compensatory fee, meant the move broke down.\n\nThe manager does not have a release clause in his contract, and Joyce reported: \"It is thought a fee of less than \u20ac10 million euros (about \u00a38.6 million) could be enough to prise him away.\"\n\nFurther adding to the speculation that he could be on his way to Merseyside, is the fact that his Thursday press conference to preview Feyenoord's next Eredivisie match has been cancelled.\n\nWhile this could just be for a mundane logistical reason, there is likely an ulterior motive to the lack of pre-match preview before their match against Go Ahead Eagles.\n\nBefore Klopp announced his departure, This Is Anfield noticed his pre-Norwich FA Cup press conference wasn't planned as usual, but most wrote this off as a simple scheduling quirk.\n\nWith Pep Lijnders and several of Klopp's backroom staff leaving, there will be plenty of vacancies at Liverpool.\n\nJournalist Dominic King wrote that Slot \"would be prepared to bring his assistant Sipke Hulshoff with him to Liverpool if the move deal gets done.\"\n\nHe added: \"It is absolutely clear now Slot is preferred candidate at this stage.\"\n\nSlot actually lost his previous assistant coach earlier this season when Marino Pusic moved to Shakhtar Donetsk to become manager of the Ukrainian champions.\n\nSince Hulshoff has taken the role, though, the positivity and form at Feyenoord has remained strong hasn't been affected.\n\nDutch outlet 1908.nl reported that Arne is \"so convinced that his agent Rafaela Pimenta is now sitting down with Liverpool to discuss the most important contract details.\"\n\nLiverpool already have an established relationship with Pimenta, who is also Ryan Gravenberch's agent. The same report even stated that an \"exploratory search for housing\" on Merseyside has already begun.\n\n\"The coach and his family have already started looking for accommodation in and around Liverpool. {"uri": "8094438815", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "08:00:48", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T08:00:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T08:00:36Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6901960968971252, "url": "https://www.dutchnews.nl/?p=234395", "title": "Feyenoord coach Arne Slot emerges as favourite for Liverpool job - DutchNews.nl", "body": "Feyenoord coach Arne Slot is emerging as the front runner to take over as manager of English Premier League club Liverpool when J\u00fcrgen Klopp leaves at the end of the season.\n\nThe five-times European champions are said to have stepped up their pursuit of Slot in recent days, aided by their good relations with his agent Rafaela Pimenta, who also represents dozens of English-based players.\n\nSlot, 45, has made a strong impact at Feyenoord since arriving from AZ Alkmaar in 2021, ending a six-year league title drought in 2023 and reaching the final of the UEFA Conference League. On Sunday the Rotterdam club beat NEC Nijmegen 1-0 to lift the Dutch Cup for the 14th time.\n\nHe has also impressed with his team's attacking style of play, high fitness levels and a meticulous approach to coaching and match preparation.\n\nHis success has been a welcome boost for a club that has been hampered by financial difficulties that have forced Slot to balance the books in the transfer market. Following the Conference League final in 2021 he had to rebuild the squad after nine players were sold.\n\nThe coach himself has given little away about his future plans, but said last week that he \"would talk to the right club if it comes along.\" He has kept his cards close to his chest after the experience of being sacked by AZ in December 2020 when they learned he was in advanced talks to succeed Dick Advocaat.\n\nFeyenoord have cancelled their regular pre-match press conference for Thursday night's league match against Go Ahead Eagles, although the club insist that decision was taken before the cup final.\n\nManaging director Dennis Kroese also said it was no surprise that Slot was attracting interest. \"He has made good progress and given Feyenoord real allure. But we recently extended his contract and won't let him go easily.\"\n\nLast season Feyenoord managed to fend off an approach from another English club, Tottenham, after reportedly demanding \u20ac7 million in compensation. Back then Slot said that he saw a move to the Premier League as the \"normal next step\" in his career.\n\nThe club also extended his contract to 2026 with no release clause, allowing them to name their price for the highly coveted coach. Transfer specialist Ben Jacobs reported that Feyenoord's baseline figure is \u20ac10 million.\n\nLiverpool could face competition from other European giants such as Barcelona and Bayern Munich for Slot's services, with both clubs looking to bounce back from disappointing seasons.\n\nBut according to Dutch website 1908, Slot has already started house-hunting on Merseyside so that he can move his {"uri": "8094549483", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "09:07:04", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T09:07:04Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T09:06:57Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6901960968971252, "url": "https://www.rousingthekop.com/2024/04/24/the-obvious-reason-why-michael-edwards-prefers-arne-slot-over-ruben-amorim-as-liverpool-manager/", "title": "The obvious reason why Michael Edwards prefers Arne Slot over Ruben Amorim as Liverpool manager", "body": "There's one reason why Michael Edwards prefers Arne Slot as Liverpool's next manager over Ruben Amorim.\n\nFor weeks on end, it seemed like Liverpool were going to go all out for Ruben Amorim. The 39-year-old Portuguese manager looked almost certain to be Jurgen Klopp's successor at Liverpool.\n\nHowever, things have changed quite rapidly in the last 48 hours. As Amorim flew to West Ham United to hold meetings, Liverpool have made advances with another manager.\n\nArne Slot is now looking like Michael Edwards' preferred choice for the Liverpool job, and it's a move that could make even more sense for the Reds than Amorim.\n\nSlot's affable and charming personality makes him the kind of character you want to replace Jurgen Klopp with.\n\nHis playing style is also very similar to the German manager. Those things combined mean things won't change too much around Anfield.\n\nBut that is not the main reason why Liverpool have favoured Slot over Amorim. If anything, it will be due to his record in European competitions.\n\nAmorim's Sporting CP have struggled in Europe. His best finish in a European competition was a quarter-final finish.\n\nMeanwhile, Slot guided Feyenoord to the Europa Conference League final in his first season at the club. He lost only to Jose Mourinho's AS Roma in the final.\n\nLast season, he also took Feyenoord, a much weaker squad than Sporting CP, to the quarter finals of the Europa League, and again lost to Mourinho's AS Roma.\n\nThis season, Feyenoord recorded some strong results in the Champions League group-stages, before again being knocked out by AS Roma in the Europa League knock-out stages.\n\nThe fact that Slot does have that track record though of taking Feyenoord to a final, and overachieving in Europe would explain why he is favoured over Amorim. At this stage in his career, Amorim hasn't quite done anything like that.\n\nIt seems like things are moving rapidly with Arne Slot. Liverpool seem to be making quick advances and are now in the negotiation stage of the process.\n\nIt would not be a surprise to see this being wrapped up quite quickly. {"uri": "8094632408", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-24", "time": "09:55:18", "dateTime": "2024-04-24T09:55:18Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-24T09:54:58Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.6901960968971252, "url": "https://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2024/04/24/edwards-a-big-fan-of-liverpool-target-crazy-about-pep-and-rated-higher-than-ten-hag/", "title": "Edwards a big fan of Liverpool target 'crazy' about Pep and rated higher than Ten Hag", "body": "Arne Slot has been on Liverpool's post-Jurgen Klopp shortlist from the very beginning of their manager search with CEO of Football Michael Edwards a fan of the Eredivisie winner.\n\nHITC understands that, despite Arne Slot's emergence as a frontrunner for the Anfield job relatively late in the conversation - Liverpool initially targeted Xabi Alonso before holding talks with Ruben Amorim - the Dutchman is not a new name on the radars of those working behind the scenes on the red half of Merseyside.\n\nSlot, who guided Feyenoord to only their second Eredivisie title in the 21st century last year, is admired by Liverpool's CEO of Football Michael Edwards.\n\nThe former sporting director, who recently returned for a second spell at Anfield, helped identify the 45-year-old as a leading candidate through his typically meticulous research and his analytical approach to big decisions.\n\nSlot held talks with Leeds, Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur in 2023 before deciding to stick around in the Netherlands and help Feyenoord defend their crown. An outstanding PSV Eindhoven are on the brink of taking Feyenoord's crown, however, though this has still been another very impressive season for the Rotterdammers.\n\nSlot's team could still overtake their title-winning tally of points of 82 from 2022/23, a testament in itself to just how remarkable this PSV team have been. Feyenoord have lost only two league matches throughout the campaign, and defeated NEC Nijmegen to secure the Dutch Cup over the weekend.\n\nLiverpool will no doubt be impressed not only by Slot's high-octane, possession-heavy football - he is 'crazy' about Pep Guardiola - but also his ability to turn good players into great ones.\n\nAlireza Jahanbakhsh, the former Brighton benchwarmer, described him as the 'the best coach in the world at the moment' around 12 months ago. Oussama Idrissi also called Slot the best manager he had ever worked with, and that includes Julen Lopetegui and Manchester United's former Ajax boss Erik ten Hag (The Athletic).\n\nSlot also helped secure big-money moves to high-profile leagues for the likes of Orkun Kokcu and Frederik Aursnes, Luis Sinisterra, Tyrell Malacia, and Marcos Senesi.\n\n\"I think Slot is really good,\" the three-time Ballon D'Or winning Dutch legend Marco van Basten tells Ziggo Sport. \"He can really go anywhere. Bayern Munich, Liverpool... I'm really convinced of that.\n\n\"I've spoken to him a few times, and he handles the player groups very well. Of course, he is also very well versed tactically.\n\n\"I can explain his ideas well. He is calm and intelligent. As far as I am concerned, he is really a top coach. I really think he can go to any club, even difficult clubs. He's very smart in his choice of words.\"\n\n\"He has a lot of qualities and he shows it at every level,\" adds the AC Milan icon. \"He first did it at AZ, and now at Feyenoord. And Feyenoord is a really complicated club. He has been doing well for three years, while PSV and Ajax have much more options in terms of money.\n\n\"It could really fit anywhere. If you get AZ and Feyenoord to play football, you also get big clubs like AC Milan to play football. You can clearly see his hand wherever he is the coach.\n\n\"I think it will even be easier for him at a higher level, because he has better players who understand his ideas faster. In the end, I also think he is smart enough to manage stubborn players.\"\n\nFeyenoord director Dennis te Kloese was reluctant to give too much away, however, when asked about that Liverpool interest He faces a major task taking over from Klopp, who has been at the Anfield helm for nearly nine years, and won the hearts of Reds supporters.\n\nFootage surrounding an altercation with United's Antony, however, will get him off to a good start as he looks to form a bond with the fans similar to that of the German's.\n\nFootage of Arne Slot clashing with Antony has re-emerged and delighted Liverpool supporters\n\nThe now-Manchester United man once feigned injury before seeing red for former club Ajax\n\nFootage shows the Brazilian hitting the deck a number of times, with Slot laughing in response\n\nThe clip, which went viral on social media after Liverpool's interest in Slot was confirmed, is from March 2022 in a game between Ajax and Feyenoord in the Eredivisie.\n\nAntony, then at Ajax, can be seen hitting the deck in apparent pain in the final few moments of the match, stumbling across Slot's technical area before falling.\n\nHe winced before returning to the field, and hit the deck again when being attended to by Dusan Tadic and Davy Klaassen.\n\nFeyenoord players protested, and Antony was shown a second yellow card, followed by a red, having been booked earlier in the game.\n\nThe camera can be seen cutting to Slot, who bursts out laughing at the winger's antics that saw him given his marching orders.\n\nWith Antony now playing for rivals Manchester United, {"uri": "2024-04-335100650", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-25", "time": "11:27:32", "dateTime": "2024-04-25T11:27:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-25T11:15:12Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.686274528503418, "url": "https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20240425-five-things-to-know-about-anfield-linked-arne-slot", "title": "Five things to know about Anfield-linked Arne Slot", "body": "The Hague (AFP) - Arne Slot, the Feyenoord coach reportedly the subject of talks between the clubs about joining Liverpool, is known as a passionate leader who gets the most out of his player and demands a strong work ethic.\n\nA fan of Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola, Slot was a slick forward as a player with a reputation as an accurate passer of the ball -- so much so he has a move named after him.\n\nHere are five key facts about the 45-year-old who could succeed Jurgen Klopp at Anfield.\n\nArne Slot Pass\n\nSlot joined PEC Zwolle as a 17-year-old striker known more for his technique than his running.\n\n\"Many people thought Arne was lazy and phlegmatic. But that wasn't right. You just shouldn't expect sliding tackles,\" his former coach Jan Everse told public broadcaster NOS.\n\nBut \"silky\" and \"cultured\" are words often used to describe his playing style, and PEC Zwolle still employ the \"Arne Slot Pass\", says former teammate Bram van Polen.\n\nThe Arne Slot Pass is a slight deflection from a forward with his back to goal which splits the defence and releases a winger running off the ball.\n\n- Dressing room style -\n\nLiverpool fans looking for clues to their potential future boss's style have started sharing a rousing team talk he gave Feyenoord players after an historic victory at Ajax.\n\n\"The reason why we are where we are today is because you work your ass off every single day. And that's the reason you could beat this team in their own stadium, without even our fans being here,\" he told the dressing room.\n\n\"But it's only a win. It's a big win, but we have a bigger goal this season than winning for the first time in 17 years in Amsterdam,\" Slot said to cheers from the team.\n\nSpurs links\n\nThe interest from Liverpool is not the first time Slot has attracted Premier League clubs. He was heavily linked with Tottenham during their troubled search to replace Antonio Conte in May 2023.\n\nAs Spurs were reportedly about to seal the deal, Slot abruptly walked out, signing a new contract instead with Rotterdam-based Feyenoord.\n\n\"The decisive factor was playing in the Champions League... the fact that I am having a great time privately and being able to build on the past two seasons,\" said Slot at the time.\n\nFeyenoord's Champions League campaign got off to a strong start with a 2-0 home win against Celtic, but two defeats against Atletico Madrid sealed their fate, and they finished third in Group E.\n\nGuardiola fan\n\nThe British press have already dubbed Slot the \"Dutch Pep Guardiola\" for the high-pressing attacking style much beloved by Feyenoord fans.\n\nSlot certainly admires the legendary Spanish coach of Manchester City, who would be among his top rivals if he did join Liverpool.\n\nIn several interviews, he has cited Guardiola as his role model, telling the Algemeene Dagblad (AD) last year: \"Players always look very good under him. And the same players seem worse with managers before and after him.\"\n\nRun, run, run\n\nAs a coach, Slot is known for a fierce work ethic, driving to Feyenoord's camp before dawn, watching every training session, and obsessively studying future opponents.\n\n\"I say to Feyenoord: you have to ensure that you create four times as many chances as your opponent and work twice as hard,\" Slot told the AD.\n\n\"In all the matches that we have won this season, we see in the data that we have run 20 or 30 percent more than the opposition. Matches we didn't win: only three or six percent more.\"\n\n\"Every training, every meeting must be spot on,\" he said.\n\nThis has led to results on the pitch at Feyenoord, seen as a team with physically fit players who work hard for each other and often score late goals.\n\nSlot appears to have cultivated this work ethic as a manager, rather than when he was a player.\n\n\"He wants his boys to be fit... he didn't have that before. I don't know if he has ever seen the inside of a weights room,\" said former teammate Van Polen.", "source": {"uri": "france24.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "France 24"}, "authors": [], {"uri": "2024-04-334597924", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-04-25", "time": "03:01:14", "dateTime": "2024-04-25T03:01:14Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-04-25T00:00:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.686274528503418, "url": "https://www.liverpool.com/liverpool-fc-news/features/arne-slot-liverpool-ruben-amorim-29056202", "title": "Arne Slot to Liverpool 'done deal' as surprise R\u00faben Amorim claim made", "body": "J\u00fcrgen Klopp's reign as Liverpool manager looks to be all over bar the shouting. Unless there is an exceptional collapse from both Manchester City and Arsenal, the Reds will not lift the title in their manager's final season at the helm, making his final four games more or less a formality.\n\nThat certainly won't be the mood at Anfield when Klopp gets his richly-deserved send-off. While he may not have got his dream goodbye, the German will still leave as one of the greatest legends in Liverpool's storied history.\n\nAnd on a more practical note, Klopp was quick to mention after the loss to Everton that Champions League qualification is not yet safe. Liverpool will want to make sure of that in what remains of the season.\n\nREAD MORE: J\u00fcrgen Klopp gives Liverpool title assessment and makes Champions League admission\n\nREAD MORE: Arne Slot could take four lessons from Liverpool loss at Everton as Dominik Szoboszlai snaps\n\nBut in practice, much of the attention now turns even more on what comes next for Liverpool. Arne Slot seems to have emerged as a clear favorite to take over from Klopp, moving ahead of R\u00faben Amorim over the past few days. Here, we bring you the latest.\n\nArne Slot to Liverpool 'done deal'\n\nIt certainly seems like Feyenoord boss Slot has been made Liverpool's favored candidate. The Athletic claimed yesterday that the Reds had seen an opening approach to the club rejected, but that they will try again, with the manager himself 'enthusiastic' about the move.\n\nIt also reported that Liverpool will continue to assess other candidates. But Dutch journalist Steve Kooijman has taken a more bullish line on talkSPORT. He claims that Slot to Liverpool is already a 'done deal', and that he will '100 per cent' be the next manager at Anfield.\n\n\"Yeah, we know him quite a bit and know Feneyoord as well,\" said Kooijman. \"They're looking already looking for a new manager - it's a done deal, yeah.\"\n\nWhether or not that's a little premature, things certainly seem to be moving in the direction of appointing Slot. It would certainly be an intriguing hire from FSG head of football Michael Edwards.\n\nR\u00faben Amorim claim made\n\nIf Slot is coming to Liverpool, where does that leave Amorim? For a short while, the answer seemed to be West Ham, with the Sporting coach flying into London for talks.\n\nBut it appears those did not go especially well. And in a surprising twist, having been admired by a number of teams and linked especially heavily with Liverpool, it's now claimed that Amorim might stay put.\n\nIn a report from Portuguese channel RTP shared by a third party to X, it's claimed that the official decision will be announced on Saturday. Amorim had previously quipped to reporters that he would 'see them on Saturday' when touching down on his way back from England, although that was thought to be in reference to his press conference
